Even after it was obvious we weren't going to eat a full meal and our bill probably wouldn't amount to much, he remained graciously helpful, making suggestions but not pushing anyone to order more food, keeping our waters topped up, joking with us while we decompressed. Dessert itself was fine, if not extraordinary. Slices were cut large. The crusts held together without being too thick or detracting from the fillings, which were nicely blended but a bit bland in their sweetness. This was not exactly a stand out experience... more like decent in every way. But the next time I visit the Whitney I will gladly stop in for a snack, because I appreciate the unpretentious vibe. Was I primed to be charmed? Well, yeah. But it doesn't matter. Bubby's has won my loyalty.
Sourdough pancakes were GREAT! But the sour cream pancakes beat them! Loved the peak of the High Line and the river from the west side view Windows.
I had the grilled salmon and my daughter had a burger. The salmon was delightful with grilled corn, and for dessert, a peach cobbler which was delish!

Just had the best meal and best service at Bubby's!  My girlfriends and I had drinks and appetizers..Our server Caesar was EXCELLENT. He went above and beyond making recommendations for my indecisive friends. We had the deviled eggs, fried green tomatoes and the artichoke dip. The service was quick and he was highly attentive. Best service in NYC!
Excellent Cherry Pie, overloaded Matzo Ball soups and A Lobster Rolls so fat and spicy Ms Blake threw in the towel.

Wow, Bubby's exceeded all of my expectations.  Probably like many folks, we stopped there for dinner since we were headed to the Whitney afterwards.  (We had actually planned on going to the Gansevoort Market - but apparently they were basically all closed up by 6:30/7pm?!?).Anyways, we sat outside on a gorgeous summer evening, the service was super-duper friendly and gave us wonderful advice on what we should order, and my food was very, very yummy!I ordered the pit BBQ with ribs, chicken, biscuit, and spicy broccoli.   As someone who grew up in the South, I've never had much luck finding good ribs in my 10 years here in NY (Dinosaur being the best we have), but their ribs were SOLID.  Juicy, full of flavor, and didn't need to be drowning in BBQ sauce.  The chicken was unbelievably tender - and also was so full of flavor it didn't need to be covered in sauce.  And the biscuit, oh the biscuit!  The waiter recommended it as a side and he was so right - it was buttery, flaky, fresh out of the oven, and came with this fantastic peach compote that tasted like peach pie.  Also - all of the above was way too much food for me - so I have a second meal to enjoy later today.  The only sad thing is that we were too full to try their desserts - which sounded delish.  All in all - a very pleasant impromptu dinner (in an overly tourist area).

Haven't been to Bubby's (Tribeca) in years. Trying this Highline location was a nice surprise. Friendly service. Terrific deviled eggs, salads and the usual bar food. Of course, the location is great.

The service good, no complaints there. However, to be frank, the food and drinks are what you're paying for. I rated this cool looking place 2 stars because the food was subpar. I ordered a water while my boyfriend had the ginger beer. He was unsatisfied w/ it because it was too watered down. He had the double cheeseburger and I the veggie burger. Simply put: tastiest thing on each of our plates were the fries. We ultimately paid 70 dollars for a meal that we could have had at BRGR on 7th ave.

Food is great! Smart design with all ceiling fans powered by one motor and rubber bands. However, since the property is great; next to the Whitney, they tried to fit the most amount of tables in a small space. You get to eavesdrop on other people's conversations though!  Anyway, I wanted to get my lobster roll without onions, but they said that it was mixed in already. I happily agreed, and when my meal came I realized that the waitress was just lazy because she wasn't writing it down, and there were onions calmly sprinkled on top. Also, my dad did not like the coffee. Definitely a go to though because they are great for kids and have good other food and ambiance.
Is this a joke? Six dollars for 2 peices of bacon. Won't be back. Bubby, your bacon isn't that great. Reality check... it's bacon!

Perhaps if we had ordered more to sample from, I'd be a happier camper. On the flip side, if we had spent more money on more so-so tasting food, I might be even more irritated. We'll never know because we stopped at two orders of Bubby's Griddle Special: $19 for two eggs, two slices of bacon, & two pancakes (add an extra $4 if you want it topped with blueberry compote.) A little steep for the 3-star quality & ordinary taste. Nothing special, food wise, but her Pickle Back (whiskey with pickle juice chaser) was quite the party starter!Pluses: + prime location across the street from the High Line+ friendly service+ laid-back atmosphere, bar has big presence + tempting-sounding sweets: biscuits, peanut butter chocolate pie, egg creams, etc., but if they're anything like our breakfast, I'll have to pass... Meh.

Waited about an hour with a group of friends (with children) to be seated. Inside was too loud so we opted to sit outside even though it was windy/chilly. Service was okay if not a bit slow. Food was actually bad. Burger and fries for one of the kids was overcooked and hard. The fried chicken was overcooked and thus dry. It was also very bland. For $24 they should really try to do a better job with this entree. Overall a disappointing experience. Typical of the neighborhood: overhyped and overpriced for blah food. Oh and did I mention there were still feathers on the chicken?!

This place is amazing! My friend and I ordered the biscuits to share. They were light, fluffy, and the homemade peach jam of the day was great. I ordered the banana pecan pancakes which were great and so filling. The caramelized bananas were the best part and I loved how the syrup was from an organic farm that I too use at home! My friend had the huevos rancheros which she said were great. The proximity to the Whitney, many cute shops, the high line, and ample hills right next door makes this a great location. If you are in the area, definitely go here!

My mom and I stopped in for lunch on a weekday. The place was pretty crowded, but we were able to get a table immediately. The atmosphere is great - very bright and well decorated. Very nice servers. Great music.I grabbed a Kale Cobb salad, which was large, incredibly fresh, and super tasty. The bacon in it is in rather large chunks, which were like getting a treat every few bites. My mom realized she wasn't going to be able to get anything that wouldn't be a large serving, so she grabbed a piece of cherry pie, which was EXCELLENT (okay, I may have had some of it...).

Excellent lunch and fun atmosphere.  Service was fun and quirky.  I had the chicken salad sandwich and my daughter had the turkey BLAT.  Both on homemade bread with tasty herbed friend fries.  All in all a very good lunch.

I took a lunch on sunny March weekday.Around noon there still was pretty much seating.Many of customers seemed tourists.I chose Griddle special,which came with 2 pancakes,scrambled egg and a link of spicy sausage,$19. As for meat you have several other option.Taste just like plain diner,nothing special.Way much pricier,that's the difference between two.I enjoyed lunch with a view of high line.But no coming back just one time is enough.Service was so so,they just did their job.

I was very excited for brunch and this place disappointed. Upon arrival the hostess was extremely rude. Our waitress refuse to move us to a table out of the sun despite the fact that there was an open table in the shade next to us empty for the entire duration of our meal. This place does not take reservations for brunch so there is no way it could've been reserved. The cocktails were crappy and the food was good. Don't ask for a substitution because they will not like it.

Bubbys grows up and comes to the Meatpacking District- shhhh. They celebrate American food and it is done right here. A large corner space on Washington and Gansvoort. The staff is very friendly and welcoming here. It is still kinda a secret as they opened recently. I have been here twice in the last two weeks, which for me means a lot. Last night I had dinner and I don't remember any of the Bubby's being this flippin' great.The purveyor list is on the menu and it is extensive and reflected in the food. They make bread, pies, ice-cream, bagels- WOW!I went with spicy cider- soooo spicy good. A special of cornmeal encrusted trout with potatoes and cherry peppers was just on point perfection. The spicyness of the vinegar cherry peppers offset the fish and potatoes. That was $26 and well worth it. House-made,Rocky road Ice-cream for dessert, one of the reasons I came back so soon. Also, love the cupcakes and the Krinish- get it KRINISH- all Delish!

My wife and I can't say no to brunch and Bubby's definitely delivered! She had a awesome Salmon Benedict and I had a great steak and eggs! 15 minute wait for a table (no reservation) Great coffee and an interesting Bloody Mary. Not the best, but still good. If you're around, definitely go! But if you're going out of your way, then head to Norma's.

Pretty typical yuppie brunch in Chelsea. We arrived at 12:30pm on a Saturday, and only had to wait about 20 minutes for a table of two. There were lots of couples and kids, so while it might be good for groups, you might want to hold your large scale booze brunches elsewhere. We ordered the burger and the eggs florentine. Our water refills and drinks weren't coming too fast, but it was pretty busy, so we were more forgiving. Our food also took about 40 minutes, but again, feeling forgiving. We then found a hair in the eggs florentine, but the waiter was very apologetic and got us a new dish. We were growing a little impatient, but the food more than made up for it. The burger was delicious, cooked just right, and the fries were crispy and salted just right. Eggs were cooked right (minus the hair), and came with a large side salad and 4 pieces of toast. Even though it's a bit pricier, the portion sizes are definitely a bit larger. After we were done, the waiter apologized for everything going slowly and the hair in the food, so he comped us a free slice of peanut butter chocolate pie. Boy, was that pie rich and delicious. The peanut butter is definitely a bit more amped up than the chocolate, but overall, the ratio felt just right. After that, the waiter then comped us another slice of apple pie for the road. What a way to work for that tip. Can't blame him though, he did what he could to remedy the situation, and in the end, we were satisfied. Dunno if I'd pay the $8 per slice normally, but it is very good.Overall, the food is delicious, well-portioned, albeit a bit on the pricier side. I will definitely add this to the list of better brunch places in the city. Also, the concept of midnight brunch intrigues me, and although I don't hang out on the West side that often, I'll keep that in the back of my mind.
Comfort food indeed. Perfect poached eggs on a huevos rancheros, delish biscuits. They serve booze after 12pm.

I took my grandparents here for brunch while they were visiting from out of town. We had reservations for 12:30 but weren't seated until almost 1:15. The food was decent, but not spectacular. The gin and thyme lemonade is very tasty though. Great location at the end of the High Line and across the street from the Whitney
Yummy pancakes!!! I mean yummy!!! Delish drinks, nice atmosphere, good service and tasty drinks. A must try for any time of the day and kid friendly.

Went to Bubby's last Saturday and had an amazing time.  My husband and I are no longer night owls so it was great to experience a nightlife vibe during lunch! The place was busy, had great music, and good food! Awesome place to people watch in the meatpacking area.  Only complaint is that the waiters were super impersonable- barely said a word the entire time.

Make sure you're hungry if you're coming to Bubby's! The biscuits & heavenly honey-butter were hands-down the best part of my meal, and my husband is still raving about the fried chicken. The wings looks delicious too - next time I'll have to give them a try. However, my favorite part was dessert.. as there is an Ample Hills in the back of the restaurant, and they let you mix and match Bubby's famous pies with Ample Hills ice cream and toppings. So try to save room for dessert.. if that's possible. You won't regret it.
Good service, helpful staff, and good food (Get the Mac & Cheese and the double burger)...awesomeness!

This location has pitiful service. Came with a group of six and was told 45 min. Little longer than we hoped but, fine. Well after an hour and a half wait we thought that was a bit ridiculous. They let parties sit and take their time to sign a check and leave. And by take their time I mean take 30 min. Countless group go before us and somehow parties of 6 also. Poor management. Okay service. Food is good but DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE WAIT. you'll be in a bad mood before you sit. This has happened to me even with smaller groups of 2 or 3 and this always happens. Save time and go somewhere else or plan on eating breakfast at 12pm.

I love this place. Its got a great Mom and Pop atmosphere with an adorable soda/ice cream fountain station. The employees have also been super helpful when it comes to ordering pies around the holidays. I got lunch their often and really loved their salads. Also, the brunch is a must. They have some of the best pancakes ever. I spit those with a friend and also got their huevos rancheros which were outstanding.  This is definitely a place I will go back to on my NYC visits and also a place I would order a pie from. Sour cherry! Yes please.

The food was great, however the service was not. Our main dishes took a while to come out. When our food finally arrived I noticed my order of the cheese grits breakfast came with bacon instead of sausage. When I told the waitress that I thought the menu said it came with sausage she said, "No, it comes with bacon". Her response was poor and she should have immediately said she'd fix it instead of saying I was wrong when in fact I was correct. I ended up just eating the bacon. In addition, a couple of tables down I noticed the hostess being rude to some other people for sitting down at a table they thought was prepared for them. After they apologized profusely for the misunderstanding she said they could sit there anyway. I'd like to come back, but the staff were off-putting.

Drinks were refreshing(strawberry spritz and bourbon tea) Food was good, we had devil eggs for starters and the chicken supper for the entree to share. Service is good as well, just the chicken wasn't what I expected. But overall definitely should check it out if you're by the highline.

I went to Bubby's with some friends for what we wanted to be a quick desert. Unfortunately we had to wait nearly half an hour to get a couple slices of pie which were already made and probably even precut. I enjoyed my cobbler however the crust could have been a bit crumblier and the baking soda proportions should be adjusted. Overall the place has a cute and comfy vibe and the sub par service probably wouldn't have been a big deal had we ordered real food but it's not a place I'd recommend popping into for a quick treat.

Came here for happy hour the other night. The Lower Manhattan was tasty, music was good and the service was great. Location isn't spectacular, so I wouldn't go out of my way to go here but if I was going to be in the area I would definitely stop in again.

Return? Not a destination spot but convenient if your in the area (e.g., visiting Whitney, High Line, etc)Atmosphere (3) - Run of the mill bar/restaurant. Nice area to eat outside. First time eating dinner here and it was packed, borderline uncomfortable/cramped.Food (3) - burger (3), beet salad (3 - not many beets), fries (4), pecan pie (4), apple pie (3)Service (3) Friendly but not very attentive - disappeared for long stretches, no silverware, etcCost = $135 before tax/tip w/ 4 drinks (cocktail was served in a ridiculously tiny glass full of ice, I'm not exaggerating when I say there was only 3oz of liquid and most of it was mixer)

I was in the meatpacking district to attend a DJ set at Cielo, and noticed a good crowd at this venue, so decided to drop in.  I sat at the bar where I was attended to by bartender/waitress Jenna.  After cooling off with a cold Bronx Ale draft, I decided to try one of the house specialties - the burger.  As per explanation, all of their beef comes from a local farm.  As a burger aficionado, I can attest that Bubby's burger was one of the best that I have ever tasted!I can't wait to return to Bubby's to try their BBQ sampler or try a cocktail from their well-stocked bar.  While the prices are high relative to New Jersey, I felt that the quality was totally on-point.Thank you Jenna for providing attentive and personalized service, and for being a great conversationalist!You can also check out Bubby's at their Tribeca location,  or for globetrotters, at their Tokyo Japan locations.

I get that this place is located literally across the street from the new Whitney and the High Line, but we just paid exorbitant prices for shitty food and shitty service. Eat from one of the food carts in front of the museum and save yourself heartache and money.

I had no problem finding a place to sit at the bar. Had the eggs, bacon and biscuit this morning. Eggs were scrambled nicely, bacon was delicious, diced potatoes were just right and the biscuit was to die for. Bartender was great to this out of town tourist. Only negative is that it a bit of a platinum cardholder kind of place, but the staff treated everyone equally.

Cute spot, kind of small but the wait wasn't too bad for two . We had to wait about 25 mins on a Saturday so not to shabby . The brunch menu is okay , wish there was more of a variety like French toast or crepes . Nonetheless I was satisfied  with what I ordered. I got a combo of eggs , 1 sausage 1 bacon and 1 pancake for $19. Everything tasted really good and our waiter was very  nice and funny . This restaurant is also in a great location , right next to the Whitney art museum .

Overall, this restaurant was pretty pleasant. The food was delicious. I got the veggie burger with avocado and shared a biscuit. Both were scrumptious, I also got the lemonade hibiscus iced tea, which was a bit too tart and I didn't taste the tea. But the rest of the brunch was delicious!However, the service was not too good. It took the hostess a couple of minutes just to notice us two. Then, although there were tons of tables for two we had to wait outside for five minutes. Yet, the food came very quickly and the wait staff was very nice.

Portions are huge! We tried the kale salad and the fried chicken sandwich and both plates were so large. The kale salad was very fresh and tasty. The fried chicken sandwich was a bit dry but still pretty good. For dessert, we tried the banana toffee cake and it was the largest slice of cake ever! So delicious though! It's perfect if you love banana flavored dessert.

Came here on a Sunday for Brunch around 10am. Luckily, when my party of 3 walked in, there was no wait and we were seated right away. Service was good throughout the dining experience. We ordered the cinnamon bun to start with and it was one of the best I've had. The cinnamon bun was probably the best part of Brunch. I decided to go with the smoked salmon Benedicts. The dish was good, but not the best I've had; however, their potatoes (that accompanied the dish) were phenomenal. The potatoes were Very well seasoned and cooked. I think there are better places in this area for brunch. Only way I'd come back would be to try their sundaes and milkshakes. :-p

We stopped in for a drink before dinner - my boyfriend got a beer and I was looking over their homemade sodas.  2 options caught my eye, the chocolate egg cream and the vanilla egg cream.  I asked the bartender about them and he said he had never tried them before - but another bartender over heard our conversation and chimed in saying he loved the egg cream - and that its a New York specialty and they (Bubbys) does it quite well.   He also said that he likes to do a chocolate/vanilla mix....well then, ok!  It was pretty darn good!  It was like drinking chocolate milk with slight carbonation.  Sounds weird, but I enjoyed it.  Might need to grab a few more this weekend while in NYC!

Came here for brunch after walking the Highline. Seated fast and to our surprise our food arrived literally within 5 minutes of ordering. I had poached eggs, home fries, toast and a side of avocado to replace the meat that I didn't want. All tasted great except the home fries were wayyyyyy too peppered. Please let people season their own food!!! *the only real negative to this place is their lack of gluten free options. Basically nothing to cater for those with a gluten intolerance which my friend has. All is all though, a pleasant experience

When I booked my trip to New York I was amazed at how many friends immediately gave me recommendations for their favourite places in the Big Apple with lots of enthusiasm. One in particular that stood out was Bubby's so when we walked the length of the High Line and it was lunch time I was so excited to see Bubby's right there! I have to say that we were most certainly not disappointed. It was really busy but in an exciting and fun way. It's quirky American diner, which was just what we were looking for. The menu was fantastic, although it meant making a decision about what to eat very difficult!I went for a BBQ pulled pork burger with Mac 'n' Cheese and my boyfriend had the pastrami burger from the specials with fries. He had beer and I went for a cream soda as I've not tried one before.The burgers were the best we've ever had. Really tasty, succulent meat, delicious marinades and good buns! I've never had proper Mac 'n' Cheese before so can't compare it but it was so much nicer than I imagined and much nicer than ones I've had in the UK. It was creamy, cheesy deliciousness! I wasn't a fan of the cream soda but that's probably more my taste. If you like cream soda, I imagine it's a good one!We were so full after our meal but couldn't resist dessert. I ordered two scoops of ice cream with hit fudge and whipped cream thinking it would be quite small and light. It was huge! More like 4 scoops going on UK sizes I'm used to! Very creamy and tasty though. My boyfriend ordered the peanut butter and chocolate pie. Wow! If you like peanut butter and haven't eaten anything for a week then go for it! Otherwise, maybe get it to share! It was delicious but so rich and huge. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the whole place was just brilliant. I highly recommend it. Also, they have a dessert for $100 which is for 8-10 people. It looked incredible and HUGE so I'd say grab your friends and head over to Bubby's!
Super busy place and stopped for a birthday lunchVeggie chili served in a shallow bowl with a few not the greatest corn chipsBut staff was great and I Enjoyed it very much
Expect to wait an hour for your food. Great place if you want to wait forever. Good luck.

Came here before the crowd on a Friday evening for a few drinks and a bite. Although we were keeping it light we decided to split the fried chicken. Prior I had not had fried chicken in a really really long time. I died and went to heaven and the table next to me caught me dying and going to heaven. The woman next to me laughed because that's how good she thought it was as well. Price wise- you are in an expensive part of town so the prices were expected for drinks and food. Atmosphere was also nice.
Great lunch location-indoor and outdoor seating. When in Chelsea don't pass it up. They were out of the lobster roll so I tried the meatloaf sandwich. Amazing!

Came in here with my brothers yesterday for the first time and enjoyed breakfast at the bar. Steps away from the High Line it's a interesting location. Everyone seemed friendly and atmosphere was great. Menu is very simple but good is very delicious. It's not a huge place but after all it is a bar/diner so that's fine. Prices seem reasonable. Food came out at a decent time.  Portions were big. I ordered the Bubbys breakfast which comes with home fries, eggs, toast and a cured meat and substituted the cured meat with chicken apple sausage which was out of this world! Pros--Great food-large portions -great atmosphere -Decent prices -friendly staffCons--small-pricey if you're on a budget-location seems a bit hard to find since its under the high line when you're on the other end of the street. Overall I had a good experience and spent quality time and hope to go back soon.

Close to one of the Whitney Museum's entrances is a bar/restaurant called Bubby's High Line. They have a nice patio so we decided to grab a drink and people watch.Shelly ordered The Angry Owl - mexcal, tequila, apple syrup, and ginger while I ordered a Dark & stormy - dark rum, homemade ginger beer, and limeAlso, we ordered a plate of nachos.The drinks were made strong, but still tasted good. But the nachos were really good - the chips were on par and a huge scoop of guacamole on top always helps.We ran out of time here, but it appears their specialty is ice cream, homemade sodas, and shakes.For more information and pictures check out our site : thegreatcubeescape.com

Went to dinner on a Sunday night and they were out of everything. My friend and I ordered the ribs and they were out. Not only were they out of that, but we also ordered mash potatoes and greens which they were also out of. Our server was very polite and apologetic but the rest of the staff was far from. It took us being ignored by 3 servers to then finally get refills on our water. For only being in NY for 3 days, we were not very happy about our experience there.

We walked the Highline and it was a lovely (and hot) day, so we stopped by here for lunch. It was OK. My husband had the eggs benedict with smoked salmon, and his was really good. I think I just chose the wrong meal (avocado toast with goat cheese- meh). I'm sure there are better spots for lunch, but it was decent.

BUBBYS - WHAT IS GOING ON!?Bobby's has been in my top ten of favorite restaurants since I was 17 years old - one bite of the peanut butter pie made me a believer. Now 33, I was amped up to try the High Line iteration during my tri annual NYC pilgrimage. I wanted to love it - I was ready to love it - but I just didn't. Now it's time for the breakdown:Pros:1) Though the place was packed on Labor Day, the hostess promised to seat us indoors in under 15 minutes, and followed through.2) The decor was on point - such a lovely, beachy vibe in keeping with the nearby park3) Mimosa was delicious, no funky cheap champagne taste and fresh squeeze orange juice, I had two!4) Extensive, yummy sounding brunch menu. I saw some Eggs Benedict coming out of the kitchen that looked spectacular.5) My mom liked the coffee. And she is particular about her coffee, so this is HUGE.Cons:1) LOUD AS HELL. Not like, busy restaurant chatter, but normal conversation was out of the question. Too many people, too many tables, and too much terrible Top 40 music at club levels. At 11 in the morning? Come on, people. I could barely hear the waiter.2) Absolutely no real options for gluten free brunching (salad is not a real option). I settled for taking the bun off my burger, but at an average price of 20 bucks a plate, I shouldn't have to deconstruct my own food. 3) Bagel platter came with 2.5 pieces of salmon and a parmesan bagel. Noticed later that the menu offered a choice of bagel flavors, but our waiter did not. Again, for 20 bucks, my mom shouldn't have to hunt among lettuce leaves for one caper at a time.4) Burned fries5) No peanut butter pie6) Hostess staff rude to my mom when she asked to see a menu again.7) A 91.00 price tag for a burger, a bagel plate, 2 mimosas, a cup of coffee, and a tip. Really?I want to love you, I do, but all my friends say that the franchise is going downhill, and this experience didn't do much to change that narrative. Get it together guys! Focus on the pies. Pies are love.

Had a really awesome time at Bubby's for my company holiday party yesterday afternoon. We had a group of about 50 and I felt like they handled us pretty well considering they had other customers in a full dining room. My favorites were the fried chicken (super crispy on the outside and moist in the middle) and the brisket biscuits.

"Bubby" means "grandma" in Yiddish, but even your hip bubby is yelling "what?" every sentence over rap music din, even sitting right next to you at tables jammed into space. She doesn't see much to eat besides a bowl of matzo ball soup, as pork & fried chicken are not bubby food. She also thinks children's meals automatically need veggies in them. The 1+2 is a bit overpriced, so she orders a chicken burger with veggies ground right in that gets its own star. The name promises "Bubby's," but skip it; only stop in to see a nifty fan/pulley system on the ceiling.

Love the decor and the proximity to High Line Park.Excellent service and large enough menu to provide a lot of variety, without being overwhelming.  I had the Salmon Nicoise Salad, which was tasty. Though I haven't tried it yet, I saw MANY burgers come flying out - definitely a popular item!!!Downgrade, Bubby's can be a bit crowded at "peak" hours.All around, both the service and the food were mediocre, nothing special. The hostess was sweet and friendly.
Comfort food at its finest. Took my wife there for brunch today, very impressed. Drinks were strong and delicious, I highly suggest the pimms cup. I can't wait to go back
Great bloody mary's and I also had a good omlet, waitress was cool and we had a nice time, would deff. go back.

Bubbys is a must. Ate here twice in one weekend. Atmosphere is perfect for a Saturday/Sunday brunch. Friendly staff. Cool decor awesome southern inspired menu. Biscuits are unreal. Simple menu excellent execution.

This is right across from the southern end of the Highline and the new Whitney Museum.  Had a bite to eat before the Friday night pay-what-you-wish hours (7-10pm)Shared the Macaroni and Cheese appetizer (really big - enough for an entree), Cesar Salad and Fried Chicken which comes with two of the buttery biscuits.  All good.  Patient and friendly service. Just what was needed before a visit to a big new museum.

We've stopped in after shopping for glasses at Warby Parker next door, having been to the Bubby's in TriBeCa a few times, I was surprisingly underwhelmed by this location. I had the fish tacos, which was in serious need of seasoning. For average comfort food, it also comes with a hefty price. Not worth it, in my opinion. P.s. A colleague of mine contacted the location recently to get a quote for a private event, their manager never acknowledged or emailed her back. They must be doing so well that small parties are not even worthy.
Fantastic food!  Went for late lunch.  I had the eggs benedict and they were about the best I've had anywhere.
Fantastic food and service.  Save room for dessert!   Mac and cheese outstanding. Great burgers.  Will definitely come back.

Wow- looking for a hip and cool place to have breakfast in the Meatpacking District? This is your spot.There's a distinct farm to table vibe.Large portions and good people watching outside.I had the kale Cobb salad hold the bacon and cheese.My friends had the traditional bagel and lox platter.All very good.

This past Sunday I spent the day in NYC completely off the grid, all by myself.  I had a great day exploring, shopping, etc.  I decided on dinner at Bubby's because I've always liked Bubby's in TrBeCa and ate there regularly when I lived in NYC.  At around 7PM I walked up to the hostesses and asked for a table for 1, this really seemed to confuse the 2 young ladies.  One asked if I was sure.  The dining room was nearly empty so I picked out my table and sat down.  The 2nd hostess asked if someone was going to be joining me.  I laughed and said if that were the case I would've asked for a table for 2.I ordered the $27 fried chicken with fries & cole slaw.  The server was the only pleasant part of my Bubby's experience.  The chicken was bland & tasteless, like it was made for someone in a hospital. The fries were fries and I assume the cole slaw was from D'Agostinos.   I never understood why people feel uncomfortable eating alone but the staff at Bubby's really goes out of their way to make a guy feel awkward. After my meal I stepped into the takeout section of the restaurant to get a Latte for my sunset stroll along the High Line.  There was one person working and only one customer ahead of me.  I don't know what the person ordered but the employee disappeared, I waited 5 minutes and went on my way.It's a nice space and it's a restaurant that gives off a comfortable, fun atmosphere.  I guess if you can overlook shabby service & subpar food, you're gonna love this place.

Love Sunday brunch!The pancakes are to die for and have the blueberries on the inside. The omelet was good. But the absolute best thing are the BISCUITS!! they are heavenly and with the homemade jam. Grant location and service. It's a brunch must!

4 stars for the vibe of this place + my side order. Ordered the fried chicken w biscuits as my side. Nothing spectacular about the chicken.. But those biscuits were delightful! I tried my boyfriend's mac&cheese & I thought that was tasty as well. Maybe next time I'll get the mac&cheese w biscuits. Staff are all nice btw :)Ps it can get prty loud here late afternoon-night. I came here before for brunch - quieter/good atmosphere for conversation.Will be back for brunch!

I'm sure Bubby's is benefiting from the new Whitney next door--that's why I ended up here on a Friday afternoon, looking for a not too expensive drink (which is pretty impossible in Meatpacking, I know). We sat at the bar and had two rounds and shared a plate of nachos. The nachos were a step up from your regular bar dish--lots of toppings and everything tasted fresh. Bartenders were fun to chat with. Overall fine experience, just loud and pricey for what we ordered. If you need to grab a bite or drink in the area, this is a family friendly option.

The service was very slow, and the food is way over priced and didn't taste that good. The pancake was so dry I need 2 maple syrups. Denny has better pancakes. The coffee was cold. The only thing I liked was the bacon. Don't waist your money.

went on a Saturday afternoon & the restaurant was very busy, but we were seated in less than 5 minutes! Had a little trouble with our server and asked to speak with the manager. The manager came over and apologized & was very accommodating and brought over a new server. Meal was good and the Bloody Mary was...average. Very touristy spot but a cool vibe and in a great location.

Came here on a Saturday for Brunch, there was a massive crowd outside that scared me a bit to be honest. We were told by the hostess the wait was 15-20 minutes -- my friends and I timed them to make sure that we didn't wait longer than was told and we were definitely seated within the time frame. We were seated outside which was nice but if only the sidewalk wasn't slanted because then the tables wouldn't have rocked back and forth. Our waitress was sweet, once seated we got our glasses filled with water -- she was very nice.My friends ordered The Double Bubby with a side of Spicy Pork Sausage (i think) and Eggs Benedict (with fries instead of homefries, the waitress said they're usually not allowed to change but she did it anyways) and I ordered the Griddle Special ( with bacon and eggs scambled ). Okay, so my friends and I were starving from the incredibly slow subway ride in from Queens and the fact that none of us ate anything since we've been awake. When we got our food and started eating, we all realized that their portions are bigger and more filling than they appear to be. My friend that ordered The Double Bubby almost couldn't finish half but considering he ate almost all of his fries, I understand. My other friend that ordered the Eggs Benedict, ate all her fries as well but also couldn't finish. I was able to eat my scambled eggs, bacon and one pancake -- my order came with two, even after only eating one I was filled with a giant food baby. But all in all the food was pretty good, some things could've been better, my friend said there was too much hollandaise sauce in her eggs benedict and it pretty much resembled mayonnaise. My friend who ordered the burger said that, the burger was "too big" but considering its $20-something it better be big. I on the other hand thought the bacon was a little over cooked, it was kind of tough to eat. And even after being stuffed my friend got a scoop of chocolate ice cream with sprinkles (lol what a big child he is). Minor things that bothered me, when I got my food I hadn't gotten syrup or butter for my pancakes. When I looked for my waitress, she was no where to be found. I sat there eating the rest of my food and saying to myself "wheres the syrup and butter for my pancakes?" -- especially when she was able to bring those two things to another table. Also, when my friend got his ice cream, he asked for sprinkles and she forgot. But anyways, we're all human and we forget.

Fun atmosphere, excellent appetizers and desserts with just OK main course both in terms of selection and quality.  We tried the chicken soup, General Tso's meatballs, and the nachos grande and all were extremely well-received.  The desserts of ice cream and  pies were also excellent.  As noted before, their selection of main course was kind of limited.  The burgers and the fajitas were OK but not great.

The cuisine here is always ideal for when I come with dining-companions for breakfast or brunch on the weekends. I highly recommend sitting at the bar, especially with small groups, and to chat and laugh with servers/bartenders Jenna and Tommy. The food is tasty and and very well prepared.

I've been before and keep forgetting that this place is just not worth the price. The pancakes are light and fluffy and the bacon was great (a smoked flavor to then) but you really can find a much better breakfast in the city, especially given the price. $52 for 2 meals and a kids meal. The coffee was also terrible - very sour. When I asked about it the waitress said that it was just a "bold" flavor. Definitely not bold, just sour. I'll happily take a diner cup of drip coffee but this was in drinkable. But I think they do switch out roasters off and on, so maybe it'll be better again. They were very kind to remove it from the bill.A few notes: someone mentioned the sourdough pancaked were not very sour/flavorful - my husband's was very strong. He liked them well enough (loves sourdough). Also, they do not allow strollers anywhere inside. Not even broken down. Luckily it was warm enough so we ate outside with the stroller just outside their gate.

So the food does taste good and the people are nice but... it is ATROCIOUSLY over priced. And no, I'm not some sticker-shocked Midwest tourist on vacation. Food is my #1 lover but $18 for a reuben sandwich?! It came on grocery store sliced whole wheat bread and had a thin layer of sauerkraut. For $18, a heaping, caveman meat pile of epic proportions slathered with Russian dressing and (at least) an inch of sauerkraut should appear before my eyes.Also, $9 for a chocolate milkshake. If I can buy a $5 absurdly overpriced cupcake in NYC and you didn't even turn on an oven... I mean...

Yummy!Love this place for brunch or just for a nice yummy lunch!Being there twice...one time I have the Huevos Rancheros and they were spectacular, great portions and simply delish!Second time I was there this week and had the Beef burger, it was perfectly cooked and everything was fresh!Ohhh and the Bloody Mary's are top notch!

Great weather, great view. Right next to the high line, which is good for tourists like me. Service was alright. Just unorganized and unclear. I would suggest sitting outside, spacey and not loud at all. Awesome for people watching while you eat. I ordered the pancakes, which were fluffy and moist. Very good.
so. good. I recommend the veggie burger! this place has great atmosphere and even greater food.
5 star just for their buttery flaky biscuit scones with house special butter and jam

We showed up at around 2 pm on a Sunday and they were out of a lot of things... the HUEVOS RANCHEROS (how do you run out of these? seriously?) and some of their juices, but otherwise it was a good experience.My EGGS FLORENTINE were amazing.  I was hesitant to order it because I don't usually love poached eggs, but here I did. The serving size was large but I still ate all of it (and was completely stuffed) because it was so good. $22 is a bit much for a brunch item, but it was also a lot of food. Add a $4 tea and tip and we're looking at over $30 for brunch.  Pricey, but good.
Love this place! Great food (those Eggs Benedict are so good that my sister has trouble not devouring them), great service, great ambiance!  we will always come here on our trips to NYC!

There's a reason that certain foods are on all brunch menus. For example blueberry pancakes that are not made out of sourdough and taste super tangy.  Or lobster roll that is not filled with extra chives.   Or coffee that tastes like jet fuel.   This place has a really good location right next to the new Whitney Museum. It's a cool vibe with some interesting decoration. You get to eavesdrop on everybody's conversation because they're only 6 inches away from you.   In short you should definitely come here if you want to try out different interesting and in my opinion not so good food options in a creative by overly cramped environment.

Very cute restaurant. Wonderful location right across the street from the Highline. Had the hue is rancheros and it was pretty good. Service was eh. Not sure if it was our waitress or the New York attitude. Wonderful patio and everybody enjoyed the food. Staff is kinda short and rude.

Stumbled upon this place last night. They have a "to go" section where you can get pies, cakes, cookies or even a "pie shake", which I am dying to try one day. The restaurant itself is dim yet noisy; a good environment though. The bartender was really friendly and we had a great time. I will definitely be back

Bubby's just gets everything right. They make fresh food, they hire great people, and they build rooms with good vibes. Had the Bubby's Double Burger and it was enormous and delicious.  They grind the meet on-premises so I can't imagine how it could be fresher, and it comes thru in the taste.  Their homemade sangria is as good as any I've had.  Such a great atmosphere inside and the team is professional and just really really nice. Sad to say that's rare but it is and Bubby's has figured it out:  hire nice people.

Came here on a tues day morning for breakfast and ran into clueless service.  Took forever to get my coffee refilled, witnessed mixed messages from staff about who could sit where outside and watched my waiter mess up the order of my neighbor twice.  The food was good as I ate it.  I got their eggs benedict.  However, later that day I felt I'll to the stomach and all I could think about was Bourdain's warning about eating hollandaise sauce.Not impressed.
Great food, really liked this place. Had the double-bubby. Great hamburger. Super friendly bartenders.
I had an excellent fried chicken and biscuit sandwich. It was an extremely generous portion with lots of lettuce and spicy mustard. It is also right by the end of the high line.

Let me first state- we came here for the name only. My son's nickname is Bubby. Always has and always will. When a seven year old hears he has a restaurant in the city named the same as his silly nickname- he makes you go, and we gladly did. We ended up going for dessert because I read "Famous for their Pie" We ended up getting to the place kind of late after getting a cab from Broadway just to make my son happy and not break a promise. We were determined to try this place for him. We get there and say we need a table for 4- for dessert. The hostess who was more busy playing a game on her phone told me we can only eat dessert at the bar. When I explain that would be impossible because I have a 5 and 7 year old. I plead with her that I am here just to make my son happy- and he just wants pie and off to cab and fall asleep and go back to the hotel. She shrugged. My husband irked we came all this way for her to tell us to get it to go- I asked if I get a meal or appetizer we can sit. Sighs- and says yes. So we do-- We get Mac and Cheese and Artichoke Dip and 4 pieces of pie and 3 Root Beers... $80 bucks. When we told them the Dip tasted a little funny- and they clearly say "Oh yeah you didn't eat any of it" it stayed on our bill for $13. The only pie that was decent was the Peanut Butter one that was super rich. The apple pie my son loved- but he was so excited to be there. The three stars come from someone coming to our table saying they heard my son say his name was "Bubby" and his birthday and gave him a "Bubby" cup. That was super sweet of them and he has shown everyone the mug that he could. It was really thoughtful.I would love to try this place again next time we are in the city.

Spent a weekend in Manhattan and heard all the hype about Bubby's. Considering the fact that I am a big breakfast person I was excited to try this restaurant out. The homely American Resturant was appealing and relaxing to the eyes. I was immediatly greeted the moment I walked through the door. Accidently walking in the wrong door in the carry out area my eyes were glazed on the pasteries and apple pie. A friend and I dined at a table top where we were again greeted by a server who welcome us. The menu was limited but had the perfect options for all types of diners. The prices were high but the type off food they sell is what your paying for. This spot cooks organic and fresh meals.I ordered a Hot Cider and Apple Pie since my taste buds craved the beautiful pie that was in the case when I walked in the door. My friend ordered a full breakfast with Blue Berry Pancakes, Chicken Sausage and Eggs. My Cider was good but it was not worth $5.00. My Pie was rather cold so I asked to have it warmed up. I did mention when ordering that I wanted nothing on the pie though it was served with powdered sugar and whip cream. Not a big deal as the pie was very tasty. I sampled on of my friends blue berry pancakes and they were delicious. She was very happy with all her food. Overall the resturant was nice, serivce was good and the location was ideally perfect for tourist. If I am ever in town I will try this place again.

Ordered Egg Benedict with smoked salmon. The moment I bit into the salmon I knew something wasn't righty. It tasted - and smelled - awful. I've been sick since. The biscuits we ordered also looked like they were at least a day old and re-heated. Would not recommend.

Make sure to arrive early if your having breakfast/brunch, because bubby's gets packed quickly and they don't take reservations. The ambiance was nice and service was great. We absolutely loved their cinnamon bun, and was big enough to share. Another must try on their menu was the sourdough pancakes! As far as my eggs Benedict it was just ok! Sad to say!

Great brunch spot in the meatpacking district with a great menu. Plus, they care about the ingredients in their food. If you're in the area, it's a good place to eat, then you can walk off the food you just scarfed down along the Highline!The spot was packed around 11am for brunch on a Saturday. Luckily, we were only a party of 2 and the weather was warm enough to sit outside on the patio; otherwise, we would have had to wait for a seat. There's lots of tables inside, but it's a popular spot!+Eggs Florentine -- yum! I can never resist a good eggs benedict. Although...one of my eggs was cooked all the way through :(+Country potatoes (part of my dish) -- well seasoned and absolutely DELICIOUS! it was country potatoes on crack. My guy friend probably stole like half of it+/- Peach lemonade -- it's freshly squeezed and tasted great...just couldn't really taste the peach. So really, I think I just drank lemonade, which was fine by me.-Slow service -- I think they could use an extra server or two...

My boyfriend and I came here for brunch before getting me new glasses at Warby Parker and we both loved it.  Initially, there was about a 25 minute wait but for this neighborhood and the fact that it was around 1 on a Saturday was really reasonable.  We walked around the corner to Warby Parker to start browsing in the meantime and I appreciated that they texted us the second our table was ready and really kept to the 25 minute wait.  Now the important part the food.  My boyfriend had the Double Bubby and I had the Bubby Breakfast.  However beware! The Double Bubby is ALOT of food.  My boyfriend actually finished his because he couldn't bring himself to stop eating it. It was really that good.  BUT just know what you are getting into if you order this.  I also really loved my Bubby's breakfast.  The over easy eggs were perfectly runny, and pairing that with house made bread, potatoes, and house cured bacon um hello could this get better?! Oh wait but it did.  The jam and butter that came with it were also house made (the butter grass fed to boot!) and delicious.  Suffice to say we were both in food heaven here.And our waiter was very attentive making sure water glasses were filled, taking the check, etc.  So all in all, totally digging this place! YUM.

We loved Bubby's as dinner after a long day of shopping and walking. I must say, Bubby's was VERY smart when buying this location-it is the first restaurant that you see when getting off of the Highline, a good thing because most people will be hungry after their long Highline walk and be ready to sit down and eat without having to search around for a place.The restaurant is very neat-it almost reminds me of an old barn-and I loved the old fashioned soda fountain in the back. Our waitress was very kind and patient with me as I ordered-I am very indecisive and always feel bad about it.Bubby's menu isn't huge: there are about 10 different appetizers/salads, 3 burger options, 4 entrees, and a bbq platter option, but the food is very high quality, so places like this usually do tend to have a smaller menu. The food is simply good old comfort food, but your typical heavy and greasy comfort food-the meals are very fresh, you can tell. If there are just a few of you, I recommend ordering an assortment of appetizers as the meal so you can try a variety of things, which is what mother and I did.We ordered 4 appetizers for the 2 of us: the kale salad, Mac & cheese, nachos, and General tso's chicken meatballs-these starters are a good size and 4 of them were the perfect amount for us.The Mac & Cheese was good and the perfect comfort food. The order of General tso's meatballs had 3 meatballs and the sauce was a lighter version of your typical general tso's sauce-not as thick and sugary, more tangy. We feared the nachos would be a huge serving like most places that offer nachos as an appetizer, but these were not-they were the perfect size for 2 of us, in fact, and wasn't just a huge pile of chips with toppings. But be warned, they aren't your typical nacho-the chips are topped with salsa, black beans, cheddar, crumbled queso, salsa, light sour cream, guacamole, and radishes-yes, radishes. These nachos are way better than the standard Mexican style ones and much fresher.On to the kale salad-we decided we had to have SOME vegetables, and the kale salad seemed reasonable. Raw kale is usually terrible, but I must say that this salad was GOOD...get it!Of course we had to get some dessert, and we went with the homemade ice cream-don't skip it! Very light and full of yummy flavor..nothing better than homemade ice cream and Bubby's makes it good!If you're walking the Highline, end your trip with dinner at Bubby's for good, fresh comfort food!

Bubby's has ditched the delicious (and good-value) grilled-cheese sandwich from the brunch menu.  We made a special trip just for that so I suppose it serves us right for staying once we found out about the menu change.Anyway, the service was fine and the food that we did have was all right (not too heavy/greasy) but the fact of the matter is that Bubby's has become really overpriced.  We go maybe 4× a year and we spend more (for less) every time we go.  Even the pancake breakfasts are almost $20 before tax and tip.

Amazing service and the food was the best. We went for brunch here and was already bummed that i had not had my stumptown coffee yet. When i found out they serve stumptown coffee, i was sold. I had the amazing Bubby's breakfast. So good.

This has to be one of the most underrated restaurants in NYC. I've been to a lot of different restaurants and this is one of my favorites. You can really taste the quality ingredients that they use. As far as burgers go, I'd rather get shake shack for cheaper and better, but as far as everything else in the menu, ITS SO GOOD. The shrimp tacos are superb. The mac n cheese has to be one of the best I've had in the city, and I've tried a lot of different places. The burrata with toast is phenomenal. The nachos are ehhh ok. But, this place is better than most places, just with the quality alone. Will definitely keep attending this place. The only downside is the price, but honestly, the fresh ingredients make it worth it. TRY THIS PLACE!

This is not about the food but rather the management. In short they just wouldn't get back to me about my request to make a reservation for 15 people. I called and they said I had to email a guy David F but don't worry he just got in. Two emails unreturned over a week. Got his phone number...voicemail unreturned. Text. Calls back asks if I have emailed him and promises to send a proposal that day. No proposal. 4 days later I ask again via text and he has no recollection of our last conversation. How frustrating! Can't imagine the restaurant owner likes losing that much revenueUpdate - they more than made up for it. Thanks!

The service was OK, the food was OK, but the prices were pretty expensive. Not sure that 2 biscuits are worn $4 or that a small plate of bacon is worth $8. The chorizo has was OK as was the salmon caviar benedict. Except that there was no caviar on either of the salmon benedict muffins. It is kid friendly and close to the high line. The strawberry jam/preserves was a highlight and the cheese grits were good.

3.75, if you have lots of time.  I'm torn.The service was very friendly but SLOW (the place was packed, and it didn't help that the server was someone who brought one item at a time per request.)  A $4 "unlimited" coffee is irrelevant if you can only get them to come fill your cup once every 50 min.The food was delicious, but everything except the potatoes came out cold.   Severely disappointing (eggs, bacon, toast, pie a la mode).  We really didn't have time to request anything else, so maybe it would have been better had we asked for fresh food.  I'd like to try this place again when I have an extra 4 hours and am not hungry yet-  it would have been lovely if not for that.

Having come straight from Italy, where a cappuccino and a pastry cost a Euro each, paying $25 for two of each comes as a shock, hence the 3 stars. Still, I understand that New York has a lot of holes in the ground and someone has to pay taxes to have them filled-in.Bubby's has an artfully contrived hipster chic. We liked it. My gigantic slice of pie set me up for a chilly walk on the high line, my wife's fake Cornish pasty, less so. The coffees were good. 'Nuff said.

We headed here on our last day of our holiday to NYC. Food is slightly on the pricey side but boy was it worth it! I had the fluffiest, loveliest pancakes I think I've ever eaten! Lovely outdoor area even if it does get a bit loud being on a main road. Would thoroughly recommend this as a brunch or breakfast place for any tourist and even those looking to do the slightly less touristy places. Will be coming back again when I'm fortunate enough to head back to the city!

I had a really bad experience at this place. First, it took a while to even get service and we were sitting at the bar. I asked the server if she had hot chocolate, she said yes. It took about 15 minutes to get the world's smallest hot chocolate that cost  4 bucks and was done in 2 sips. Whatever.Apparently, they were fresh out of their signature biscuits at 10:30 am. I ordered the breakfast and requested 2x to make sure there was no bacon. Of course, after waiting for 20 minutes, here comes my dish with bacon all over it. I cancelled my order right there. I was over it. For my 45 minutes at a restaurant, I found it to be a total waste of time and money.Went to The Standard and had a great time! I'll never go back to Bubby's again.

Perfect addition to the neighborhood. Comfort food without all of the extra frills and and too cool crowds. It's the perfect place for lunch. I sit at the bar grab a sandwich and I'm never disappointed. Now that the Whitney is open it is a bit more crowded but it's well worth it. Solid comfort food in a solid setting

My first Time at Bubby's, was shopping in the meat packing district and as we walked by the smells were so inviting. Alex our waiter gave us the best service of any dining experience I've had. Was hoping to get Bbq Ribs but by 3:30pm they were out? Had fried chicken and Bbq chicken with Mac and cheese on a scale of 1-5 they were a 2, service was a 5, onion rings and matza ball soup were 5star, I will give place one more try, burgers looked awesome and I really want to try the Ribs but for now I'll give 3 stars

Stayed at the standard and was craving a full meal at an American eatery. A quick search found Bubbys within a nice, short walk from the hotel and we walked in with no wait for a table for two. We got a small table outside and my first impressions were excited as the smells of everyone else's food were making my mouth water. Even though we were there around 6 pm we were saddened to find out they had no happy hour deals even though our server repeatedly reminded us about the bar specials. I ordered the Bubbys double burger which was obviously the go-to. Service was fast enough and when the burger came out I couldn't have been more satisfied. This double stacked burger was love at first bite. To eat it alone was a challenge, I had to keep the small wooden steak in the middle the whole time just to keep it from crumbling. Every aspect of it was perfected, the bun was crispy and buttery with a third middle bun to support the two substantial burger patties. The Bubbys "special" sauce was a familiar but still tasty addition and the toppings were all fresh. It came with a sizeable side of fries that were also delicious. Overall the atmosphere and food at Bubbys was a great dinner experience and while the food and drinks were a little pricey it seemed to be aimed for nearby hotel guests/tourists so the cost made sense.

I was excited to try Bubby's for the first time for their five and dime happy hour. Headed over there to find that the 50/50 martini and the daily punch that are marketed as part of the happy hour were not being offered. Only wine and beer were being offered when we arrived at 5:30pm when the five and dime happy hour was supposed to go until 7:00pm. The bartender was not apologetic in the slightest. Disappointing after all of the advertising for the five and dime happy hour on DNA, thrillist, etc, that it wasn't as described.
Great location for a nice outdoors brunch near the highline

Bubby's. Nice ambiance, good service, large portions, but soooo over-priced for average to slightly above average food. Which makes me knock this place down to a 3 star. Came for a super awesome dinner party with some of my favorite people.  Items that I'd recommend: onion rings, sloppy joe sliders, burgers, and pies! I DON'T recommend the fried chicken; it's kind of dry and way overpriced.

Perfect Sunday brunch for the summer. I had the eggs Benedict and the waitress kindly substituted the potatoes for grits with no problem. My wife had the huevos rancheros and if you are a cilantro fan you will love the green rice. Both dishes were great and the service was excellent. The highlites of the male were the iced coffee and the watermelon lemonade. Both were delicious right down to the little square ice cubes. We'll be back. Soon.

Once rated the best fried chicken in town by my girlfriend and I, Bubby's has lost it! I'm told that there is a new chef! However, no excuse for terrible fried chicken that tasted like a wet sponge! However, The service and lemonade were on point!

Went for a late lunch on a Monday with my mom and her hubs after taking them to walk the high line. Place was busy but able to seat us immediately. My mom ordered the nacho appetizer as a meal with chicken added. Huge portion but quite unexciting. Her husband had a burger and chose a salad as the side. He ordered the burger well done, so I really can't tell you if it was good or not. He did not leave a morsel on the plate, though. I selected the fried chicken and biscuit sandwich and the sautéed spinach as my side. The biscuit was pretty legit but the chicken lacked flavor and there was way too much honey mustard smothered everywhere. We split a slice of pb chocolate pie. That was, far and away, the best part of the meal. I'm indifferent. I had to look up the menu online to remember what we ordered. That never happens. I always recall my food. The most remarkable thing about the place is how unremarkable it is.

Fun time at Bubby's and good food. Great fried chicken, biscuits and deviled eggs. Comfort food on a somewhat limited menu. I get the sense this isn't exactly a locals place-felt like lots of bridge/tunnel people and tourists (I could be wrong here) but still a fun spot with a cool atmosphere. We would go back most definitely.

Went there for Father's Day with Dad, niece, nephew, sister in law and brother. We had1. House salad with roast chicken:  Not bad, but left some fatty skin residue on the chicken I had to scrape off. The chicken itself was quite good; the salad was generic, mostly iceberg lettuce with a few grape tomatoes and orange peels and the occasional radish2. Bell and Evans Roast Chicken: My father said it was good; seemed bathed in some type of roast chicken liquid.3. Fried chicken and biscuits: My brother said it was excellent.  I tried a morsel of a biscuit; it was very buttery and very delicious.4. Chicken Burger: Was reported to be fine5. Vegetarian chili: comes with tortilla chips, cheese on top and sour cream.  Was excellent (but salty--but I love salt)My niece and nephew were acting up, and the server showed the patience of Job, so a 3.5 star experience was upgraded to a four star.  The restaurant wasn't too crowded.  It's a very comfort-food type place, not farm to table, super-healthy, artisanal, etc.

If you are on a search for the best Mac'N Cheese around, look no further!  We kicked off with the deviled eggs - loved the horseradish burn.  One of us had the jalapeno egg biscuit sandwich and she devoured it - said it was amazing.  I had the kale salad, which was lovely but as good as it was, I have to admit I was envying my daughter as she rolled her eyes blissfully every time she took a bite of her Mac'N Cheese.  Has a great looking breakfast/brunch menu.  Will have to check it out next time.  Fun location too - jumped on the High Line afterward and walked off our lunch.

Dropped in after visit to the Whitney on a cold blustery day for a coffee. Listed prominently at top of drink menu are Fall Drinks Valrhona Hot Chocolate and Spiced Mulled Cider. Kids wanted hot chocolate and we were informed by the bartender that Neither HC or hot cider was available. Had some cold apple juice which was good.

Good food, good deserts, nice location, nice ambience... Only deterrence is service. The hostess did not want to sit me in an area even though the restaurant was empty because she wanted to sit me in a specific "zone." When i said, "thats not very customer-centric!" She nodded in agreement and acted as if she had no control. Then, when I asked my waiter to come over bc the soup was not hot, he visibly rolled his eyes. We ordered desert and it took 30 min to get it.

Service was not great, wobbly table issue was not solved by 3 staff members. In the evening the ac does not work or doesn't work properly so the entire place is hot and humid. The taco platter was good but the house chicken salad was awful. The pieces of chicken sprinkled on salad were not pieces, they were chunks! Unappetizing! Drinks were good. Because of the awful salad and the humid sauna like atmosphere I will have to give this place two stars and can certainly say that I will not be back.

I've been here only once in my life and I'm already in love with this place. The service is great and the food & drinks simply divine. Their homemade sodas are absolutely delicious. I strongly recommend the vanilla egg cream and the cherry lime Rickey. They also have a wide assortment of appetizers and entrees. Honestly some of the best fries I've ever had. They even provide their own filtered water for you to sip on while you wait for your food. The prices are reasonable. The service is amazing and the ambiance is even better. Indoor and outdoor dining are both offered. Sitting outside, sipping on soda and gobbling down fries and nachos is honestly a great way to spend an afternoon with friends or family. I strongly recommend this place for anyone visiting New York and for people who live in the city.
Yummy, great place right off highline.  You have to try the biscuits!  I liked the music but I could see how others think it's too loud.

So the coffee sucks, and almost has a sour taste too it. The food is expensive and certain dishes lack...But the pancakes...oh my lord. The pancakes are far and away the best I have had in my entire life. I've been all over the US, no pancakes are like these. Bubby's pancakes (thats what they are called) are fluffy, full bodied, flavorful, buttery, honestly they don't even need maple syrup or butter

I came here with a group of friends on a Sunday night while I was in NYC for a quick stop. They were really nice and flexible when I kept having to move our reservation time back. The decor is super cute and fun. We had great service, our waitress was really helpful, attentive, and friendly. Since there were like 7-8 of us, we took awhile to all get there and then to decide. But she kept bringing us our drinks and let us take our time. Plus it's in a great location. My friend and I walked the highline first during sunset and Bubby's was super easy to find right at the end! I really liked this spot.

Bubby's. Very fun place!  After enjoying all the high-brow happenings at The Whitney, the (self-proclaimed) Mayor of Meatpacking suggested we have a bite here.  So we did!Decisions were made: glass/bottle?? Bottle! Next, what to eat?? Hmmm, burger? Nope!  Charred gorgeous peppers, even the sneaky hot lovelies!  Wow!  Next, nachos!  Another yum!!  All in all, not crazy pricey, a bit noisy, but not awfully. I've actually been here a couple of times, never disappointed!  The bartenders are hoot, and cute! Worth it!

1). It is unbearably loud in this place.  The walls, floors, and ceiling have nothing to absorb the sound, and they play loud music.  You have to yell to be heard from across the very small tables.  2) It is very hot.  Admittedly it was a mid-summer day, but the air conditioning wasn't powerful enough to keep the place cool, especially near the doors.  I would guess it was 82-84 degrees where we were sitting.

I loved the matzoh ball soup and pastrami sandwich.   The soup had good chunks of carrots and celery.    The pastram sandwich was really yummy and doesn't disappoint.  My daughter loved her chicken and biscuit sandwich and she's usually a picky eater.  My friend liked her salad and Bloody Mary.   The restaurant isn't cheap but I thought it was worth it and not too pricey for nyc.

I was there on Friday the 2nd, I had made reservations for 2 for my friends birthday. On the comments I asked if they did anything for birthdays, which I got no reply nor did the host bring it up, we got sat at the most perfect table for two though. Once we got sat, the waiter " Thomas M" came and greeted us and almost immediately wanted to know if we were ready to order. We hadn't been there for much time and had only been seated for less than 5 mins. He had suggestively sold us on a signature drink and I just stuck to what I love. None the less we got the drinks, I went to the wash room, which there was no toilet paper, but I helped myself to put in a new roll that was under the sink, no biggy, I sat down and noticed we had water in our cups, awesome, and the waiter came back almost instantly and asked if we were ready to order, I had just sat and told him sorry I didn't bother looking at the menu I just got back from the bathroom, he said no worries and had came back a few mins later and took our appetizer order, and then our entrees after. Our wings came, and no site of Thomas to check in on us, but I spotted him at the server station on his phone and chatting it up with co workers, I noticed when he had greeted and took care of other guest, he has poured their waters and refills for them, but for us that was NEVER the case. It started to make me think not such good thoughts about him, it almost felt that we were singles out, and I felt it was almost a race thing, he probably thought he sees a Hispanic couple and we probably weren't going to tip because every other table he had was shall we say, NOT Hispanic. Our food came and it was amazing "well mine was" but seeing that again Thomas had never came back to our table to check on any of our meals, he wouldn't have known that my friend wasn't really enjoying his chicken burger "which he never told us that it was an up charge for the cheese, I got the avocado, but cheese, really?" See I base my tips off of service. And there was lack of, there was maybe 5% attentiveness, I work in the restaurant industry and I've been in the industry for a while now, and I know great customer service is key to getting a great tip. It bothered me to my core because if he had even came by twice to make sure our wings were good, drinks as well, then I wouldn't be writing such a long horrible review. I probably would have ordered a second drink and my friend probably would have ordered that desert that wasn't suggested to us. But I guess not. Even though my Mac and cheese was amazing and my side of fries and my jack and coke was poured to perfection. I don't think I will ever return to bubby's nor will I recommend this place to anyone.

Ugh... I have been thinking about their burger with grilled onions for over a day now. Maybe it's because I no longer live in the U.S. and I crave a proper burger but this can't be healthy!  Lol. Ask for the chipotle inspired mayo. Service was swift and very friendly. It can be a little pricey though as they charge you for every add on and I was greedy. I love the mason jars for tap water!
Legendary biscuits, great coffee + attentive and friendly staff are the biggest pros. Comparing to Bubby's at Tribeca maybe too crowded.
This is comfort food, but it's pretty boring. There are few choices outside the box they have conceived.  But if you have young kids, it might be a good choice.
Mediocre food, worse service.  Is this a tourist place?  If it's not, I don't see how they'd be able to stay open.

Holy eggs and bacon batman. I got the bubby's breakfast. Some amazing hash browns and bacon. Biscuit was real good. A little pricey but good. 25 for breakfast plus tax and tip. Only reason why it did not warn that fifth star.

Pro: Nice decor.Cons: Service was horrible!!!!!!!!! Our server was aloof and didn't smile once at us. And slow.Food was only "OK" and overpriced. I guess you don't come to the meatpacking district for the food. The $28 salmon entree was a sad portion of salmon.The pimento cheese appetizer was tasty but was obviously sitting in the window too long - the fried pickles were cold when it was served to us.Also, when the food runner brought the appetizer to us, our server tried to say "kitchen's mistake!" and take it away - thinking we had gotten it already. Really shows how much she was paying attention to our table...Ugggggh what a terrible experience.

this is 5 stars! easy 5 stars... its always packed... and maybe i should dock .5 of a star because it is maybe overpriced... but its good! nice outdoor tables and good service... right near the start of the HighLine so convinient enough to do both if tourism is your thing... fried chicken for breakfast? its a great start to the day...

I came to Bubby's by the recommendation of my brother-in-law. My sister-in-law and I ventured from Brooklyn to spend the day in the city.  It was very busy when we walked up at noon on Friday. However, we were told there was only a 5 min wait. They were very accommodating with the stroller in two and helped us to store in the back. Once seated we opted to order their special Blackberry Fizz drink sans alcohol.  The non-alcoholic version came in a standard size mason jar. It was very refreshing and not overly sweet.For lunch we split the Cobb salad, side of hush puppies and side of Mac n' cheese. Upon asking they made the Mac to include rosemary and bacon like the main course option. Everything was cooked to perfection. And the highlight of our meal was the bacon. I'm not a huge bacon fanatic, but the sweetness and not overly salty bacon was the perfect complement to out meal. Upon asking the secret, we were told that they butcher and cure their own bacon. Oh boy, you can really taste it!!

This was a fast paced noisy restaurant. We were seated immediately at the height of Sunday brunch (2pm). We were very nicely greeted by the hostess staff. I loved the interesting decor, eclectic with a meat packing district industrial look. They boast that the do all in house butchering and smoking of the meats. They also have an area of the space dedicated to an old fashioned soda fountain, for which the have homemade ice cream. Since it was Sunday brunch, the menu was limited to breakfast selections and burgers. Our sever showed up and made several suggestions of her favorites on the menu. She took the order and off she went. We were given our requested water in the cutest end little mason jar glasses and carafe. I ordered the chicken burger with was fresh ground chicken w/zucchini, carrots and fresh herbs, topped w/lettuce and tomatoes, on a whole wheat bun. When it arrived it was served w/fries and the most amazing house made pickle. Honey ordered the tradition burger with cheddar cheese.  Both burgers were excellently cooked and very flavorful, juicy and delicious. Would really like to return here in the future for lunch or dinner to have more from this very interesting restaurant.

Had a nice brunch here Saturday afternoon following a run along why high line/west side highway. It was packed when we arrived. The hostess took our digits and we received a text within 15 minutes. Both of us ordered the lobster roll. It was okay. Service was attentive especially given how busy they were.
Food is very good and don't forget the Pies!The Chef/Owner couldn't be a nicer guy.

Yay for Bubby's!! Just left off the last star as it was a little more expensive than we expected it to be, but otherwise topped the charts.No bookings, kids! So if you ya wanna get seated with ease, get there early.Sourdough pancakes are totally ace, and I must say they absolutely nailed my over-easy eggs.Friends were happy with their dishes - a request was put in for extra crispy bacon, and they got just that! Meat is cured in-house, too.Mason/jam jar glasses, fun staff (Jung, we love you!), good cocktails, nice rounded filter coffee and buzzy atmosphere. Just wish we had room for dessert!

This was one of the worst dining experiences we've ever had in NYC. We arrive to the famed Bubby's shortly after 7pm on a Friday night. The restaurant was semi busy yet over time became full. After repeated inquiries of the status of our order, the waiter attempted to calm our complaints by offering us biscuits and French fries. Yet numerous table that ordered well after us received their food before us. Never in my life have I left a restaurant before the entrees arrived and refused to pay until this night. After yet another table that was seated and ordered after us were served their food my family decided to leave and get food elsewhere. Terrible experience!

Food was average, service was terrible. We waited for about 15 minutes for our drink order - and only half arrived. We waited another 10 minutes for the rest (they were only lemonades!). The main dishes came after another 15 minutes - and 3 were not what was ordered. We were 8 adults and 3 children. Waiting that long was not a pleasant experience. They are so many better places to go in this area. Disappointing because we are fans of Bubby's in TriBeCa.

Wonderful gem of a restaurant. Friendly servers and really great food. Love the 'defending the American table' concept. If it's possible to complain that the bacon was a little too hearty - and that's saying a lot for this here bacon lover - that would be my only complaint. Wonderful coffee such that I bought a bag and some mugs home!! The lard biscuits... Now those are my jam!! Never did I think I could find a proper biscuit outside the South. Well done Bubby's!

Everybody needs a Jewish mother, whether sick and needing chicken soup or priming for a walk on the High Line which starts on the next corner.  We found Bubby's while shopping in the Meat Packing district and found an authentic retro soda fountain (egg creams and all), a bar and just about every American menu item you might want (There were murmurs of best burger in NYC).  I had a good endive salad.  The staff was attentive and went above and beyond when we had to wait longer than they thought appropriate (comped desserts all around!!!)  Great Ice cream.Enjoy

My boyfriend and I ate here on 08/09/15. He ordered the Chicken Burger and I ordered the Double Bubby. My boyfriend said that of all the burgers he had eaten the one he ate here was the best! Mine was delicious also! I just want to make a comment about when our food came because I found it funny. The one who brought our food automatically gave the Double Bubby to my bf and the chicken burger to me. I guess its because it was double beef so the portion was bigger than the chicken burger so he assumed my boyfriend ordered it and I ordered the chicken because I'm small! Lol... Just thought I'd sharw that. It was a breezy Sunday night it was chilly but tolerable and so we ate outside. Its a pretty cool restaurant. Our usher was this lovely, friendly gal. I liked her. Our waiter was kinda rude but he got the job done. We noticed he was like that to everybody anyway. Overall, we'll definitely come back! Two thumbs up!!!
