I can't recommend this place more highly.Perfect spot for brunch after walking the Highline.Friendly service, reasonable prices for what is excellent locally sourced food..just delicious!!

Don't take the hostess up on waiting at the bar until your reserved table is ready unless you're planning on getting drinks. Veggie burger was underwhelming and fell apart easily while eating. Fries were soggy. Only saving grace was the pie which was absolutely delicious.

I used to like Bubby's a lot. Used to be a great place for a good chat, good cocktails and good food with friends. I was very disappointed yesterday when I went back after one year and realized how much it was degraded! Went there for brunch with family. Food was very mediocre and expensive for what it was. 20$ for a simplest omelette of broccoli and cheddar. 23$ for a simple garden salad (very few leaves) and 2 ounce of seared salmon. 4$ for 4 small pieces of toast with very low quality (I mean the ones you can get for 2.99$ per bag from your grocery store not the multigrain loaf of a good bread from a good bakery!) Service was super mediocre too. Anything about Bubby's is now on the Medicare end of the spectrum and prices on the expensive side! Bottom line I used to recommend this place, now it's an absolute NO!

Great atmosphere and really yummy drinks. The music was awesome! Food smelled excellent but we didn't grab anything to eat. Service was only ok. The one bartender seemed to be very overwhelmed for Friday happy hour. This place is close to the high line and is a fun stop if you don't mind having a lot of attention paid to you.

That medium rare beef burger was so good. If I was only judging this restaurant based on their burger they would be getting five stars but the burger I had can't carry this restaurant. Lunch breakfast is over priced and over greased. The Bloody Mary was lacking in every way. I would still come back for the burger.
We Just had Drinks ( super cocktail ) and a snack to share (but it were the best taco's i had in my life ) while visiting the neighbourhood. Would love to come again and taste more !

This place is fun and it has great food.  Service is not so hot.   Just one example, we waited outside for breakfast (it is supposed to open at 8), totally fair that they may have had a later start as it is the weekend so we politely and quietly waited outside in full view of the team with our baby.  We waited and watched while the staff sat and ate their breakfasts, one by one getting up and strolling around, chatting to each other.  No sense of urgency with us in plain view, we tried the door but still locked, someone came to the concierge desk, saw us, grabbed a stack of menus and walked away.   We would have been totally fine if someone had stuck their head around the door to say 'sorry we  are running a bit late, could you give us five?!'  But to see us and ignore us?  Pretty rude.  Such a shame as we love that place. We went round the corner to High Street on Hudson. Friendlier, amazing food, great coffee. Try the pastrami.

Eating fried chicken, drinking bourbon and  listening to Johnny Cash. Could be great but the food is so salty I'm afraid of how puffy I will be tomorrow. Not to mention over-salted food doesn't taste so great. Salads only here from now on.

As a long time customer I would've given Bubby's a 5 star review. However, the new menu and chef has changed this place to another NYC ripoff. They removed the griddle special which was pancakes (the best NYC), eggs, meat for $19. Now in order to get the same thing it will easily be $35-40... for eggs, pancakes, and meat...?!So I went with their $15 bacon egg and cheese, that barely had an egg on it and a sad slap of cheese, the bacon was like leather. The bagel must've been shipped from outside of NYC because it was bland/stale. Could've had a far superior BEC at a bodega. The couple next to us were complaining about the new menu and the changes in their favorite meals too. If it ain't broke don't fix it. So long Bubby's, you've lost a lifetime customer. Let us know when you change back. Such a bummer.

I think Bubby is the Yiddish word for grandmother. This restaurant is pretty cute, well decorated and conveniently located near the highline. I actually came here for brunch on a weekday and the place was filled but not overly packed. We managed to snag a table outside - it's always fun to dine al fresco during the summer, but moreso on a street that's not heavily trafficked.  For brunch, I tried the omelette of the day (fritatta w eggplant) and the genmaicha tea.  The omelette came w home fries (slightly blackened) and grain toast (yum). Can imagine this to be a tourist spot. Looks like multiple entrances to this restaurant and we did have some trouble locating the hostess to start. Overall, good experience.

Really nice place for good food and respectable prices. I would recommend this place and eat here again. I would take both friends or a date here. Service was timely, staff receptive, food very good, and a nice ambience. We both ordered burgers, hers which I still had on my mind the next morning.

I came here for brunch with my friend. I love this location! Located right in the middle of the Meat Packing District, seconds from the Highline, a minute from The Whitney, minutes from the West Side Highway bike path and walking path, surrounded by tons of art galleries and high end shops, Chelsea Market just minutes away. The food here is great. We got the biscuits to share which are homemade and come with butter and homemade jam. I got the homemade granola and yogurt and my friend got the stuffed french toast. Everything was so tasty and flavorful. Loved it all! The have in door and outdoor seating. Love the outdoor seating; you can take in all the people and goings on of The Meatpacking District. Our server was incredible! Such a nice guy. He moved things along because my friend was going to a show and he chatted us up about shows as well. You can't make reservations for brunch so expect a large line. Go about an hour before you want to actually eat. This place is not cheap, but totally worth it.

We had the Chicken--the best fried chicken ever--and you are not going to believe this--It is not greasy in the least--I am not sure how you make fried chicken not greasy, but they do.. All the sides we ordered were authentic and fresh--real mashed potatoes!!! I am a real mashed potato freak and these were particulary good.  Great comfort foods--the burgers also look fantastic!  Great job Bubby's--we'll be back!  The biscuits were hot and flakey and very good.  Everything we ordered was just perfectly prepared and the service was excellent.  It was a great place to talk and visit with friends.

Goodness I hate Meatpacking. Everything about it. Well, except maybe Bubby's. Came here with a friend at 10am on a rainy Saturday. It was already pretty packed, but there were still plenty of seats at tables and at the bar. We sat at the bar. The bartenders were chatty and friendly, very good at what they do. They left us alone to chat and took our order when we were ready. We started with the biscuits. Now, I don't expect a New York brunch spot to know how to "actually" make biscuits, but these weren't too bad. They make them their own way and that's okay, too.My friend had the huge plate of pancakes which was bigger than herself, and I had Bubby's breakfast. Choice of eggs (fried), meat (bacon), breakfast potatoes and choice of bread (wheat). Boy, was I full. Granted, you could get this meal at a zillion diners around the country for half the price, but you're in Meatpacking in New York. Expect to pay double what you think the stuff is actually worth. I dunno, maybe they source the stuff from farms, etc. I don't look too much into that thing, but the butter and jam were pretty darn good.Coffee was good, too. If you can get a seat here for brunch, why not.

One of my favorite little places in NYC. Amazing cherry pie. Stumptown coffee. Had a great plate of BBQ. Every detail is fresh and thought out. Service has always been friendly and attentive every time we have been here. A must visit, just down the street from Chelsea market.

Great atmosphere under the HighLine - nice dining room and outside space if the weather is right.  We had a late lunch and while the burgers looked great we went for sandwiches and salads which might have been where we went wrong.  The Cobb salad was easily the worst I have had with very drenched lettuce and over dressed as well.  Felt like it had been sitting in the dressing for awhile.  The blue cheese was good quality and everything else was okay.  Sandwiches and the side of fries were considerably better but nothing too amazing.  Hibiscus tea was tasty.
Loved our casual brunch here.  The pancakes really are "that" good.  Had a good time and the service was good.

My husband and I went for lunch with our 4 year old. We left with no hearing and unhappy. I was so loud that the waiter apparently could not hear anything we ordered and sent us fruit instead of fries, missed our drinks, and several other things. As he also disappeared for the majority of our time there, our lovely bus guy corrected the order. I think this is the type of place you go when you are 20, after a long Saturday night out, still possibly with makeup on your face, same Saturday night clothing. When you are 40, looking for a good meal, and decent service, this is not it. Really, it was just awful and my ears are still ringing.

We had two beef and chicken burgers here. The meat was sun-standard, over-greasy, and had no taste. The mac and cheese side was below standard. I don't know how you mess up mac and cheese. It's too bad there isn't a lot of great food in this neighborhood but avoid this place like the plague.

A bit over crowded. Mediocre service and food, nothing special. The hostess was sweet and friendly, ambience was great. Poor estimation on seating time - we were told 10 mins when we first walked in but had to wait 1hr 20 mins to get a table (party of 4). The food is definitely not worth that kinda wait!

$15 cab ride to get my family of 5 to the restaurant. Wait 45 mins for the server to tell us that this establishment does not serve alcohol until NOON?  You may think that this is a lame excuse to rate them so low, but I do not.  The last time I came to Bubby's I had their jalapeno infused Vodka with a Bloody Mary and it was absolutely amazing.  That is the excuse I used to get my family there because Lord knows we can buy an overpriced brunch EVERYWHERE in NYC.  Needless to say, we got up and walked out and went to 44 & X.  So happy we did!

I went here for brunch on a relatively quite Thursday. I usually love Bubbys however this time I was not impressed. Waited 45 minutes for very average food. My bagel was rock hard and my friends lobster roll was also hard not a soft brioche. Such a shame I won't be going back. The Tribeca location seems to be better in my opinion.

My lobster roll was delicious! Their lemonade hibiscus iced tea was so good! Not too sweet just enough!! My husband loved the fried chicken and biscuits! I would def come back here again! Service was really good as well!

Came here on a Sunday night. The restaurant was out of six or seven menu options. We sat down and were barely noticed, let alone served, and it was a pretty empty restaurant that night. Our waiter took our order. Years later, he brought my mom's soda, clanking the glass bottle onto the table and walking away without further comment. Throughout our time at the restaurant, our waiter couldn't have cared less that we were there. Time passed. Seasons changed. We were not checked on, offered additional water, or acknowledged in any way. The food tasted fine when it finally arrived. So that's good. But the experience made the food seem unimportant. Our waiter's attitude and general lack of attention or care was legitimately offensive. I would have spoken to a manager, but there didn't appear to be anyone in charge of this trainwreck. I won't be back.

The food was AMAZING! Such a cute spot right by the highline. My only complaint was the wait. It ended up being about an hour when they originally predicted 1.5 hours. The good thing is they will take your phone number and text you when your table is ready, so you can explore the meat packing district or even walk the high line for a little while you wait. The service was great once we were seated!

I love our trips to New York as I always have experiences clearly different from the Midwest where I live. It was just one of those nights where the next day we kept remembering glimpses of the previous evening and re-living a very fun evening.The food: Large portions and very tasty. My wife and daughter loved the salmon, done just right. My son-in-law was talking about the fish tacos he had last trip and so he ordered the same thing and loved them again. I decided on the fried chicken for a change of pace. Loved it. Our salads were good as well and so were the appetizers and sides. I liked the mac and cheese in particular, but all the sides were delicious.Jeff was our server and he kept the food and drink coming...and the laughter.  We were stuffed, but Jeff told us we had to try their desserts. We shared a wonderful chocolate pie and a key lime pie and they were incredible.Nobody is up like this night after night, but on this occasion, he was a lot of fun. One of my daughter's friends stopped by adding to the fun and it turned out she and the bartender were friends as well. Ricky turned out to be quite a card himself. We decided to finish up the evening with something at the bar; We had a few more good laughs; Then walked the High Line--The whole area was just rocking and as visitors, we greatly enjoyed the walkway.

i usually go to the one in tribeca and had no idea this was there! right next to the whitney! had my usual bacon, potatoes and biscuits! love!!!!!!!!!! my friend also enjoyed her pancakes with eggs, sausage, and bacon. bragged to her saying they had the best bacon! she also tasted my potatoes and biscuit and loved it. just a great place in the city for breakfast!

This is a review strictly for the bar. I live across the street from this Bubby's  location and I am frequent customer here for brunch and dinner.I went on a Thursday night, around 10pm and asked for a Dark and Stormy. The drink literally tasted like a ice and sour mix. I never send back a drink. But it was that bad...I told the bartender politely that my drink was too sour. He offered more simple syrup. I felt like he wasn't understanding what I was trying to say. I offered him a a sip. He said he doesn't know what a Dark and Stormy is supposed to taste like because he doesn't drink them.He then brought a bottle of whiskey and poured it in my drink in front of me, telling me "Now there's a lot of booze".That's great service and respect for their patrons, eh?

Great spot for lunch and their bloody mary's are the best I have ever had. It gets crowded for weekend brunch but we were able to get seated fairly quickly. Service was great. Definitely will be back.
The pancakes are AMAZING! They are def on the pricey side but it was honestly worth it!
Best nyc brunch. Pancakes  so good, I Dream of them. Everything is super fresh and perfected. You must try a pie for dessert !!

Had lunch here today with an out of town friend  - my second time - the food was excellent as I knew it would be but the MOST outstanding feature of today's visit was the remarkable service. I am on an extremely restricted medical diet - one which typically makes servers want to run screaming from the table due to all the accommodations that need to be made. However, today's server, Sam, was absolutely incredible - Not only did he take my order with  good humor, genuine empathy and notable grace, he went WAY out of his way to consult with kitchen staff - coming back to the table several times to make absolutely sure I would be able to have everything exactly to specification. Even if the food had not been outstanding (which it was for its freshest of fresh ingredients and lovely presentation), I would return just to experience Sam's perfect customer service - this will absolutely be my post-Whitney place from now on - or maybe I'll just continue to bring tourists here so they can see New York at its best!

Tommy the bartender is the BOMB.  So much fun, kept me laughing the whole time.  Our drinks were on point and he is so handsome!!!  Made us feel very welcome. Will definitely be back. Worth every penny!

Brunch here is solid.  I've been here twice and enjoyed both times very much.  It's super popular, so the earlier you get there the better.  It's also nice and calm in the morning.  As it gets later, it get louder and busier, like any other brunch place.The first time we were here, I had the huevos rancheros which I enjoyed.  The green rice was great and the eggs and beans were solid.  It's not a necessarily a go to huevos rancheros, though.  I've definitely had more compelling versions of this dish.  I also had the turkey sausage which was okay -nothing special and it didn't necessarily add anything to my meal.Their pancakes, though. Whoa.  I rarely have pancakes just because it takes a million years to burn all that off, but I tried some of my friend's blueberry pancakes and they were delicious.  After that first time, I was like, gotta come back for the pancakes...and I did today!  The pancake servings are HUGE so we shared a helping of the chocolate chip pancakes between 3 people.  Today, we also shared one of their hash dishes -it wasn't the corned beef, but a different type and we practically licked the serving plate clean.  The meat was flavorful along with the sauce which was some sort of BBQ Brisket situation, maybe?  Their watermelon lemonade is also really refreshing and I'm not one for watermelon. Definitely a great place to eat with friends or if I have visitors in from out of town.Oh, and both times our servers were really friendly and helpful which is always awesome.
Great place for burgers in the meatpacking district next to the High Line.
Great brunch spot in the meatpacking district with a great menu.Busy on a Saturday but everyone I dealt with was very pleasant. Would go back.
Pre dinner shots were a nice change. All were very tasty. Waitress was very funny and made dinner a fun event. Fried chicken serving was half a bird and tasty. Good restaurant vibe.

Noise and crowd as expected in a venue opposite the Whitney..but not the mediocre food....Fried chicken and biscuit were both unworthy of the hype the restaurant generates.  Chicken was  tough and stringy under a too hot  mustard sauce and the biscuit, a holdover from an earlier meal.  Lobster roll was deemed OK, but the fries limp and old...Not  at all like my bubby's.

3.5/5 for me hereMust get the local berry pancakes as they were epic (3 massive, heavy pancakes that could feed 2 people - but I finished mine all alone :) ).  The rest of the party had a mix of eggs, omlettes and meats that they all enjoyed.Service was a bit iffy and this was before the 12pm brunch rush, so not sure how loud and disorganized this would be in prime-time.  I would recommend grabbing a bite here then heading to the high-line to walk off all the calories so the location is ideal to keep busy afterwards as well on a nice day.  If possible, get there early to avoid any confusion.Buon appetito
Not only was the food incredible, and the service sublime, but our server chased us down after we left to return my pocketbook. Excellent place to take visiting relations.

The location is great. The food was average at best but the service was excellent. We had the Fried Chicken supper, Bubby's Burger, and Bubby's Breakfast. The location is great being right on the Highline. Would recommend this as a decent place to go to but would not strive to have breakfast/brunch here again.

Maybe it's my own fault for ordering gazpacho at an American restaurant, but it was sweltering out and I thought a cool soup would be refreshing. It wasn't. First, I asked for the soup without cream on top. It came out with cream so they brought me a new one. Unfortunately this one didn't have any olive oil, which would have helped cut the overly acidic soup. It was overpowering broth that tastes like raw garlic and white vinegar. The chopped bits of raw red onion and green bell pepper didn't help things. I should have ordered a side of avocado to cut things, but after paying 10 bucks for this mouth assault, I decided against it. My dining partner had a fried chicken sandwich, which was underwhelming, according to him. I think it's the fact he paid 17 bucks for it that made him less enthusiastic about it. The fries were well cooked and tasty. I wish we had just ordered a bowl of those. We would have left happier!The servers were very nice and kind. We always had fresh water, which was crucial for choking through that gazpacho.

This place is a delight every time I come here. They don't take reservations, so there's usually a line for brunch, especially as the weather gets warmer. Happily the people at Bubby's are pros... and they simply take your cell number and text you when your table is ready, leaving you time to walk around nearby if you choose.  The staff is wonderful - from the hosts/hostesses to the waiters to the runners.  The signature pancakes (James Beard recipe) are yummy and substantial.  Tasty on their own, you can take it up a level by adding beautiful, vibrant blueberries or sautéed bananas and walnuts (the walnuts are in the pancakes).  I've also had the eggs Benedict which are good as well...perfectly prepared.Looking around at the other tables, I know I'll be back. There lots to sample on the menu and those burgers look like a must have!It is a little pricey for brunch, especially if you add in drinks...but I've always left happy and thinking nothing but happy thoughts!

My boss took me here for dinner during fashion week. It was FREEZING out, and Bubby's was so warm and cozy.Our server was really sweet, and I had to take my meal to go to catch a show and he was super accommodating and made sure it was ready in time. I ended up eating it later on that night, it was the nicoise salad, so delicious! Sadly, I didn't get to have pie..but last summer I had it at the BK location (closed) and it was to die for.Can't wait to come back and be able to sit and enjoy :)

Unless you are a FULL BLOWN TOURIST and have a strong desire to be shit on there is absolutely no need to eat here.  The service sucks big time.  When an establishment hands you a check paper clipped to an advertisement and the bill is $67.50 and they return your change from a $100 bill as $32.00 once again paper clipped to the advertisement it leaves something to be desired.  It's not about the .50 cents; it's the principle.  I still left the asshole waiter 20% when I should have left him nothing.  This took place over a week ago and it's still upsetting to me.  I eat out a lot and I'm not demanding at all.  I just believe that if you are a waiter/waitress either whether by choice or necessity, you should do your job with dignity and respect.

Mac and cheese great! Finally a place that nails the nacho's. To bad they do not have tv's cause the wings were also excellent.  If you want comfort food, hangover food or just really hungry this place is good. Drinks were ok but food made me forget what I drank! We will return!!!!

I've been here a few times and haven't written a review yet ... Excellent service and large enough menu to provide a lot of variety, without being overwhelming.  First thing they will "warn" you about is that they are known for their desserts - specifically pies, so if you can, save room!I've most recently had the Salmon Nicoise Salad, and on another occasion the Kale Salad with Grilled Chicken added - both were excellent though the Salmon salad was a bit large.  Last night it was pretty empty so got a quiet table in the corner - perfect for a relaxing evening.They can be a bit crowded at "peak" hours / nights but overall a nice cozy spot to pop into for drinks at the bar or a light dinner.  Though I haven't tried it yet, I have seen MANY burgers come flying out - definitely a popular item!!

Is it possible to give a place ZERO stars, negative until infinity stars? What a completely pretentious place attempting to be the opposite (pretend-tious). It touts itself as being part of the community, supporting local farmers but could not be less supportive of a customer with celiac disease. NOT ONE GLUTEN FREE OPTION! How is that possible at those overly inflated prices in NYC? It proudly offers in season ingredients for its egg omelette and those were potatoes, scallions and dill. That's it. No other choices, no substitutions. A joke. Save yourself $55 per person (for pancakes, bacon and biscuits) and shitty coffee and go to the unpretentious diner on the corner of 14th st two blocks away. Lesson learned.

Love the bubby's decor and the proximity to my apartment. However, both the service and the food were lacking. My friend and chose to sit at the bar rather than wait for a table. The hostesses were sweet and friendly. The same cannot be said for the bartender. She was rude and basically ignored us for the entire meal. First, it took her about 10 minutes to ask us if we wanted water. Second, when our food arrived she failed to give us place settings. After we asked for our place settings she ran away so fast we had to yell to her to bring us ketchup.(The bussers and runners were extremely helpful in all of this). The food was okay, nothing special. Everything needed salt.

DON'T GET THE RIBS! We sat for 12 minutes until I finally asked the hostess if we could order wine, she told me she needed to get a pen and paper. She got it to write down "Malbec", LOL. Our water finally got to our table 7 minutes after that with the Malbec, no apologies.We both ordered the Ribs & Pulled Pork dish, comes with one side, we both had mac & cheese and ordered baked beans & slaw.The sides dishes were all good, however the Ribs were horrible! So chewy, tough, tasteless, we could not eat them. Our waiter was not familiar with the menu or how the Ribs were prepared. There were 3 Rib sauces and he didn't know what they were, he kept going to the back and ask, very annoying. Manager kind enough to offer complimentary dessert and adjust check for the crap ribs. If you're gonna feature a Rib & Pulled Pork dish it better be amazing, not uneatable. Amazing $18 ribs around the corner at Half Pint.The menu surprisingly limited here.

Worst Ice Cream I have ever eaten. Bubby's is great if you are in the mood for fried chicken or pie, which they have been serving for year's at their other locations. The new Ice Cream Shop that was added to the High Line needs to change drastically if they want it to survive.  Bubby's charges $12 for a sundae, which is ridiculous even in the sea of $10,000 handbags that is the meatpacking district. What do you get for your $12? A pasty ice cream substance that tastes like air in a tiny container with watery syrup and tasteless whipped cream. The ice cream was completely flavorless. The only decent thing on the sundae was the nuts, which Bubby's can't claim responsibility for. The service was equally terrible. This is "Bubby's to-go". They serve ice cream and coffee. It took us nearly 20 minutes after we ordered to get our sundaes and we had to remind the counter people to make them. The woman in front of us had ordered an ice coffee and it took her equally as long to get her item. You can't run a to-go service that way. Do not go here. Seriously, just don't. Bubby's stick to your day job (and by day job I mean pie).

Went here for a work lunch.  The food was decent, but way overpriced.  I'm glad I didn't have to pay for it.  I ordered tacos, which I believe was a special.  Now they were good, but I can get better tacos from the taco truck down the road from me for $2 each.  $20 for two tacos is a bit much.

Came here for drinks after  trying to just sit by the bar at the overrated Sugar Factory and being unsuccessful. The bartender was very pleasant. I tried the pomegranate margarita which had a unique, but great taste and my partner had his usuals. I also was tempted, but hesitant to try the egg nog which was listed as a special and I'm glad I ordered it(spiked) because it was delicious. Looking forward to coming here again for a bite and dessert.

2 main dishes and two iced coffees $50....I coulda gotten a better sandwich at a local deli for less than half the price. My husband and I are highly unimpressed!  My bagel was toasted too much and hard to chew and my iced coffee tasted like instant cheap store bought coffee....just really unimpressed
Good enough at almost everything: location by the High Line, food, sangria. Best waiter I've seen in long time (thank you for your work man!)
Great service from the hostess to our server Phoebe Excellent place for brunch. Additionally our server was very attentive and knowledgeable. Will definitely be coming here again.

This was our second visit.  Enjoyed food and service on first visit in May.  Second visit in summer was awful - crowded and food was not good - turkey roll was dry, bacon undercooked, salad was arugula with a root of some sort and a few tiny apples and NO dressing.  The peach pie tasted like apple without any flavor.  The only good things were the coffee, ice cream and the service.  We felt sorry for the server who clearly has to work with a lousy cook.
Southern style comfort food. Mac & cheese is velvety smooth.

I like this place. I'll definitely come back. I was seated quickly. The bourbon sweet was strong & delicious. I only had one because I need to make it home. lol I ordered the nachos & added chicken. They were really good. Nice place to grab dinner after visiting the Whitney Museum.

Mediocre.  A glorified diner with exceedingly high prices and crappy food, redeemed only by the service, which merited a second star.The original Bubby's was a novelty in Tribeca, when it opened - two decades ago! - a barren neighborhood starving for decent restaurants.  The next one was in Brooklyn (under the bridge); that bombed and closed.  Now in the Meatpacking Mall.  Doomed.I had dinner on North Moore a few weeks ago, and it stunk.  This is even more a huge disappointment.  The "signature" dish -- and how signifying is it for a joint to say something is a "signature" --- is the bbq.  Lame, and insipid.  They try to seem cute with "regional sauces," but that got done decades ago (e.g., Red Hot & Blue in Georgetown, DC), and these sauces are embarrassingly pale imitations of what matters.  Ribs are gelatinous.  Pulled pork is dry, and unredeemed by the sauces.  Chips with blue cheese dressing are at least three times the price they'd be anywhere else.  Nachos are what you'd get at any shitty bar in Queens, at four times the price.  Forget the pies, which are supposedly why this place opened in the first place.  Way expensive, and taste like Pepperidge Farm, at nine time the price.Invariably empty, unless there's a posse of teenager girls celebrating a sweet 16, with their parents picking them up outside.This will close by the spring.The only reason I give it a second star is the service, which is enthusiastic, like the waiters on the Titanic.Garbage.  Avoid.
Great bar with good vibes. Really enjoyed it and the onion rings were dope. A little pricy but not too bad.

Great last minute decision to walk the High Line and ended right in front of Bubby's. The  burgers were delicious and the fries were incredible, perfectly crisp on the outside with great flavor. Also, the mac and cheese is a must try!

What a great way to end a nice stroll on the high line and before crossing the street to the Whitney Museum.  I was surprised we got seated so quickly outside, given it was such a gorgeous day today and there were a lot of people walking the high line and going to the Whitney. I was also surprised that we got our food so quickly (less than 10 minutes), despite the fact that it was a full house both inside and outside the restaurant). And our food was awesome! I ordered the market omelette and my daughter had chocolate chip pancakes that were awesomely fluffy.  The chocolate cream soda, though, was bitter.  My daughter could not finish that, nor did I want to finish it.  My coffee was a tad sour, and that's one thing I don't like about coffee.  Our waitress, Phoebe, was extremely attentive and provided excellent service.  We will definitely be back the next time we visit the high line.
Great burgers.  Service is good and bartenders are friendly and will make honest recommendations. Monday was kind of dead but heard it gets busier during later part of the week.
Great burgers great banoffee. Good atmosphere. Nice beer. Enjoyed the evening and right next to the high line. Would go again.
Burger was diesel and delicious! Fun atmosphere and right in the heart of meatpacking district. Review would be higher if prices were lower.

Wanted to have lunch before our visit to the museum. We were able to get a table after a short wait. Our son has food allergies and the menu says to bring any allergies to attention of server.  This typically means restaurant is sensitive to allergies. When we brought it up to our waiter he shrugged and said he couldn't be sure there wouldn't be an issue???We said it again and he shrugged again. He wouldn't even listen to what our son was allergic to.  We walked out and went to Dos Caminos where we had great food and service.

Went for brunch this weekend with high hopes based on all the hype.  Was sorely disappointed.  The service was not good as it seemed like the wait staff was more interested in chatting with each other than taking orders & tending to tables.  My kids were served chocolate milk that was turning & tasted awful!  When we mentioned it to the waiter, he just said "we've been serving it all day with no complaints." No apology.  The ice coffee had a bizarre sour after taste.  The only reason why I give them 2 stars is bc the food came out quickly and was very good.

I don't necessarily want to give this place a bad rap... I would say that it really lands in the 3.5 area for me.  I went over here with a few folks for lunch during the week- so my review is solely based on weekday lunch.  The ambiance is really nice- open rustic feeling.  We were seated right away- and everyone from the host, to the waitress to the bus boys were excellent!  They were really nice and super attentive which was great- check on 2 stars for that!  They give out free seltzer (as they should..cause its really just water with bubbles- but I won't digress into that....).  Our table ordered a bunch of different things...to share, including a few sides...I personally got the chicken burger...and this is when things went a bit south.  While nothing was terrible- nothing was really amazing (other than the hush puppies...those were really good).  As soon as I bit into my chicken burger I understood why they give us such a big bottle of seltzer-  because everything was SALTTTYYYYYYYYYYYY!!! Woof- I felt like I had salt with some chicken burger on the side.  My friend who had a regular burger said the same thing.. The fries were ok... the mac cheese was pretty decent, but overall I left super thirsty and kinda feeling meh.  Maybe it was a bad day...or maybe a big ca of salt exploded everywhere...either way just ok...  If you are in the hood and need a quick bite- I would say stop in- especially if you are a salt lover.

My boyfriend and I visited Bubby's this past Sunday for brunch. We were a little discouraged when we arrived to find crowds of people waiting. We got in to the line anyways to get our name on the list. They told us 40 minutes and we decided that wasn't too bad at all. After about 20 minutes they called my name (moral of this point is don't stray too far! They over estimate the wait time) We were seated outside looking at the High Line Bridge. We were instantly given menus and water but it took about a good 10 minutes before we saw a waiter. I wish he would have told us the specials - the table next to us was told the specials after we ordered and I would have ordered the special had I known. I loved the food anyways and so did my boyfriend. We will definitely be back and this time we will ask to hear the specials!!
Loved the food.. Loved the location.. Loved the service.. Waitresses were nice. I like knowing where my food is coming from. Next time I come back to NYC I will definitely eat there again!!!

Right next to Highline. The atmosphere is appealing and they offer outdoor seating though that can fill up quickly. Nachos are super tasty yet spicy. Shrimp tacos were loved by my partner. Desserts were a disappointment. The cookies n' cream ice cream was pretty bad. Apple pie a la mode was aslo a let down. I'd come again but only for their food.

Great place located in the heart of the Meatpacking District with upbeat music and a good sized outdoor patio ideal for people watching. The Eggs Benedict were SO AMAZING! Even the potatoes that came on the side were absolutely delicious and not your average side dish. I also thoroughly enjoyed my Bloody Mary. Yum. We went for brunch on Saturday and even with a lot of people waiting we were seated within 15 minutes. They send you a text when your table is ready so you can roam around the area a bit and not be confined to the sidewalk which was helpful.
Great salads, burgers sand pancakes. Right at end of Highline. Across street from Whitney museum. Good service. Kind of loud. Short wait. $25 per person total.

We went to bubbys on a Friday for brunch after a snow storm.  I ordered the matzo ball soup, pastrami sandwich and Mac and cheese.  My girlfriend ordered the pulled pork and hush puppy's.  The food all around was quite good. We also ordered fresh squeezed oj which was excellent. Service was friendly but a tad bit disorganized.  They seemed like a new staff; this location did open recently. Only real negative is that they threw away our "doggy bags" but when they figured it out they made us new ones to take home.  Solid all around experience.

Exceptional food and service in Meatpacking District next to the High Line.  I recommend the healthy granola with fruit & yogurt.  Finely sliced fruit complements a hazelnut crunch w exquisite flavorful morsels in every bite. Could not finish it - very filling.  Great location across from the Whitney Museum.  Family gathering place.  Zero wait time.

Food was pretty good. Loud crappy rock music made the overall volume very loud -- people were shouting over their pancakes to have conversations; I had to wear earplugs to muffle the high pitched shouting. Stop the noise pollution, people.
Bubby's has some great breakfast eats and the service was friendly and attentive.  I definitely will return next time I am back in the city.
I don't know why it has 3 star when it has some of the best nachos and shrimp tacos I've ever had!! Perfect for post museum treat!!

I love Buddy's at TriBeCa but I tried the one at the Highline it was one of the most awful NYC experiences ever. The menu was limited compared to TriBeCa. Our waitress was extremely rude & impatient. It ruined my joy of Bubbys cause I traveled from another state for brunch there at the highline. The waitress had a mean attitude (especially when I asked questions about how I wanted my food made & my drink) & she snatched my friends credit card from her hand. Wish she was fast with our food & with service. But no she was fast with getting our money. Everyone was nice there just look out for this waitress named Caitlin G she will ruin Bubbys for you. The food was good here but the Bubbys in TriBeCa was unbelievably the best brunch I had ever.  Don't go to the Highline go to TriBeCa.

Awesome, Awesome place that I highly recommend.Amazing all natural, local grown food. Great drinks and an amazing atmosphere.We also had an incredible bartender who knew his stuff.... I wish I remembered his name - but I do remember he does voice talent on the side and mixes incredible drinks complimented with great stories and lots of information.This was one of my favorite places on our recent visit to New York.If possible I would definitely go here on my next trip to the Big Apple!EDIT: Bartender name was Tommy!
Admittedly, I only stopped by for a drink yesterday, but the decor, ambience and service were notably exceptional. I'll elaborate on this review after I've had a chance to eat there too. Till then...

New favorite brunch spot!!!!!!! first off let me tell Yall about the location right across the street from the highline entrance,Hudson river park is right down the block it's the perfect place to wait as your table is getting ready. My girls and I derided to have Sunday brunch here last weekend admittedly the wait was quite long for a table but it's was well worth it as we were seated. We started with an order of buttermilk biscuits that tasted like heaven on earth so warm and flaky  we also ordered the seasonal pastry basket which I recommend you all order the apple walnut cake was to die for. Lastly our meals I ordered the griddle special w/bacon I'll admit I didn't really care for the bacon but the pancakes made up for it they were so dense and fluffy with just right amount of sweetness. The rest of my friends ordered the bubbys special which they all raved about the chicken and apple sausage. Overall we were all satisfied with our food oh I forgot to add the service was excellent our waitress was super nice and not too pushy. I will definitely come back to bubbys !

After a visit to the spectacular new Whitney Museum, we dropped in here for  lunch.  No reservations and though it was busy we were seated right away.  Joshua, our server, was a really happy guy, singing along with the music and tossing off a little French and Italian.  He was helpful and friendly but not too. We split the kale salad and burger and washed them down with a Cote du Rhone.  The kale salad was good - the grapefruit was a nice touch.  The fries were good too - skinny and perfectly cooked. But the burger - oh my God - so chewy, juicy and filled with char-grilled goodness!  The beef was obviously very high quality and perfectly cooked - medium rare on the inside and nicely charred on the outside.  Summary:  This is a friendly fun place with fresh and tasty food and a lively atmosphere. Would definitely come back again.

Bubbys used to be great but I've been there today with friends and it was awful. The hostess seemed like an amateur: didn't know what to do and was very rude and unhelpful and kept us waiting standing for 30 minutes even as our table was ready - the table was unoccupied the whole time as we burnt in the sun. The manager was able to take us to table, but only after a good half hour waiting.The waiter was almost as bad as the hostess and made a mistake with payment the resulted in us leaving 10 bucks over what we told him to charge for tips. Food is good but very expensive and the awful service definitely makes it not worth it in a neighborhood with so many good options.
Normal breakfast, 2x the price Paid 20 bucks for a fucking friend eggI bet the chef is a middle aged bitter French man who never made it in the good restaurants

Excellent French toast! Although the price is high for brunch, Bubby's certainly have he best French toast I've ever tasted. Besides the french toast, if you prefer the savory breakfast, the home fries, sausages and the bacons were also outstanding!

Their fried chicken is the best fried chicken I ever tasted..it well seasoned and butter soft I mean it melts in your mouth..the waffles are thick fresh and delightful.... The Mac and cheese is like that real cheesy home cooked Mac and cheese.. Omg! The general tso meatballs are very spicy but very good... And the home made apple pie was scrumptious...this was a very good meal..

I've eaten at Bubby's and stopped in for just drinks on numerous occasions.  It's always been our go-to when friends were visiting.  However, I'm so disappointed in my last visit, I'm not sure if I'll return.  I arranged to meet a friend who's new to the area there for a mid-week lunch.  I knew that they didn't let you bring your stroller in, so I brought my umbrella stroller to fold up small and I had hoped, put by a coat rack or by the entry where it'd be safe.  The hostesses were completely rude and had serious attitude from the minute we stepped in.  They said I had to leave my stroller, unattended outside.  I'd forgotten to grab my lock as I've never needed it with this stroller, so I asked if we could sit outside and keep it folded out of the way by us.  They originally said yes, but then as we folded it up they said I couldn't put it by us and I could only leave it at the door, outside unattended.  I've never had bad service at Bubby's, but this was appalling.  Yes, I should have brought my lock, but they did not need to speak to me with such disrespect.  If it wasn't going to work, all they needed to say was "I'm sorry, but we can only accommodate strollers outside the entrance."  The way they spoke to us was humiliating.

Great place for a noisy "New York" weekend brunch. Bring your out-of-town friends! Always packed, but once you are seated, you always get your food quickly (sometimes too quickly!). Varies from healthy (excellent salads etc.) to decadent (pancakes, eggs, sausage, burgers etc.). It's basically an upscale hipster diner, but they make everything from scratch themselves. Probably, objectively, you could say that it's a bit over-priced for what it is, but it's worth it in my view. I have never been disappointed - which is remarkable seeing as how busy they are. They always have a great selection of craft beers on tap. Staff are friendly and attentive - somehow they always recognize and welcome us even though they have thousands of people going through there every week.

Waited online on an overcast day to score a Fred & Ginger sundae in a takeout container and it was kinda worth it (well-organized, friendly staff, well-stocked and with understandable restrictions, and reasonable folks on the line). This is a very nice space and I have also been to Tribeca one, but have still never tried their pies. "Bubby's High Line is set to start slinging old-fashioned sodas and sundaes -- and they're giving away free ice cream, sodas and sundaes to mark the new menu."

Very attentive and friendly staff. Cappuccino was great and had some awesome latte art. I had the salmon Benedict and granola. Both were spot on perfect. I have always loved eating at bubbys and I would 100% recommend you do the same.

Bubby's burgers are the best I've had pretty much anywhere.Start there. Now to the details. The Double Bubby can only be ordered medium or so the waitress said. That's not happening for me since I like it rare. But the deal on that burger is sweet. For 2 bucks more than the standard burger it comes with cheese and bacon! And two patties, even though the meat oz. serving is the same amount.The $$ are fairly high for burgers, 19 to 21 bucks. Fries mounded high and a pickle accompany that. I opted for a salad instead, and it was a nice large excellent salad!Beer selection quite good, nice wine list also, beer reasonable- wine typical NYC at plus 10 bucks and up a glass..The side of spicy broccoli at $6 was done to a T. But at maybe 6 floweret sized pieces, the serving size was in the "stingy" category. Take note of that Bubby peeps.Desserts are killer, the pies and cinabon look alike selections looked great, we had the brownie cheesecake sans the extras worthy of $11 and all alone was $6.Dynamite tasting but smallish piece of cheesecake.   A $75 meal, was it worth it? It's New York right? 2 burgers, 2 beers, a tine veggie side and dessert should cost that much right?You decide.Plenty of 20 somethings all the way up to boomers seen enjoying a Monday night out.The place is all windows so on this 10 degree day, the middle of the place was the only comfortable place to sit. The seats near Washington street were FRIGID. Just a heads-up to the coat crowd,
best veggie burger i've ever had. the hibiscus lemonade arnold palmer is so good too. didn't get a chance to try the pie but everyone else was ordering it around us-will have to try next time.

Bubbys is really cool, burger was actually really amazing. The food and our waiter was great. The one issue I did find with bubby was the host, dude had a serious attitude upon me and my crew entering the place

meh. Restaurant itself is cute and in an awesome location steps away from the entrance to high line. Service is horrible. We walked in and I had to track down a waiter to be seated after circling the restaurant once or twice. To order, we had to waive down our waitress. To get dessert menu, we had to waive down our waitress. The whole process was an unnecessarily long. The food is average and a bit overpriced, but the drinks are amazing. Their soda (I had the root beer) was amazing. It's old school house made soda which is a rarity nowadays and I would go back just to get the soda. Between 2 of us, we had 2 burgers (one classic and one pastrami burger) which were both decent. No complaints. Our starter, a spinach & artichoke dip, was amazing, and the mac & cheese is also good. Overall, decent food and crappy service.
Went for Brunch.  Had a great time.  Cold pressed juice is very good and the pancake entrees are very big.  I recommend sharing!  Delicious.Had very nice service.  Definitely recommend.

Service was attentive.  Ambiance was nice.  Decor and music was cute, 50's & 60's themed.  The food was pretty good albeit expensive, $17 burgers.  They were delicious but no burger is worth $17 if you ask me. Minus 1 star for the prices. Good place to eat if you're in the area and before you hit up a club or lounge in the meatpacking district.

Doing a day date in the city brought my husband and I to The High Line.  We walked from one end to the other and ended up at Gansevoort St.  It was around noon and we planned to have a good dinner after seeing Wicked (AWESOME SHOW, GO SEE IT NOW) so we just wanted a small snack/soup to hold us over.  Bubby's was right there at the end and had great reviews.  I ordered the vegetarian chili and my husband ordered the matzo ball soup.  We obv had to get adult beverages because it was a day date (day drinking FTW) so we ordered hot bourbon apple ciders because it was a little chilly and we sat outside, taking in the cuteness of the meat packing district.  Drinks were strong!  Definitely warmed me right up!  And the soup/chili was delicious!  Only negative comment I have is that after we ordered, the waitress came back saying there were no more matzo balls, so they could make it more of a chicken soup.  They asked if he wanted toast too and he said sure since matzo ball soup isn't really the same without the matzo balls... amiright?!  So like I said the food was good, we both agreed, however, when the waitress brought the check, she charged $4 for the toast.  I know it's the city.. and prices for everything are inflated.. but really?  toast?  $4? especially when what he ordered wasn't available?  You couldn't just give him the toast for free?  We didn't say anything because it wasn't a huge deal, I was just a little surprised that they actually charged for it.  The place was packed, esp inside so you know its a good place for brunch/lunch.
Good all American restaurant and a good option around Whitney museum. Opens late and weekend and a fun place to grab a drink with friends
Such an awesome place....food, service, vibe - its all good.But im going to recommend you DO NOT go here, selfishly as i dont want to wait any longer for a table thanks ;)
I came here with a large group after fashion week and we were  accommodated and had a wonderful waitress.  Wonderful breakfast would eat again.

I'm being a little generous with 3 stars. Went there 8/24/14 for dinner. Asked the host if they had broiled salmon. "I think we have it for breakfast" was his reply. OK, we've got a moron here - line from Scent of a Woman. When I was seated I found broiled salmon on the menu. The food was OK but with so many great restaurants within a few blocks why bother with morons and just OK food.
Delicious food! Great craft cocktails! Friendly waitstaff. Homey decor. Worth the price, I walked out stuffed!

Came here for dinner based on previous okay experience for brunch -- what a mistake! I had reservations for 2 via open table for 8pm on a crowded, busy Saturday, there were two hostesses, I gave my name and even spelled it, the rude hostess addressed me in third person and spoke to her colleague about me as if I wasn't present. The rude hostess said "what's her name, I don't even see her reservation, I can't hear her, " yup, all this in front of me and my friend, I whipped out my phone and showed them my reservation. We were seated by the nicer hostess who had on a laced long sleeve top. The dinner menu was limited, a notch better than French Roast, the place was full of Bs and Ts and tourists, don't go here for dinner, the hostess is rude and the menu disappointing. Go to Serafina, Dos Caminos or Scarpetta.

Incredibly rude front of house staff. Waited an hour and thirty minutes on a cold and rainy day, returned within the 5 minute window only to have our table given away right in front of us. Not only was the hostess unapologetic she was downright rude rolling her eyes at me and protesting she did NOT give our table away, saying we were late to return, calling out that I'm pregnant and accusing me of being aggressive. The manager was standing there the entire time and did nothing to diffuse the situation or apologize. I didn't mind the wait, I understand the location and date meant we would have to wait. I mind being treated like garbage and someone being particularly rude to me and mentioning my pregnancy as the reason I was upset. Can't comment on the food - smelled good but looked overpriced. Try some of the other restaurants in the area instead - this one needs to learn the value of customer service.

Get the "griddle special" if you want a little sweet and a little savory. Add some chocolate chips to the pancakes and BOOM you are in business. Got there around 9:45 on a Sunday and had ZERO problem getting a table for two right away. Seemed the wait started around 10:15 tho so short window of luck we jazzed with.

Not good enough. Like this place for friendly staff and lively atmosphere but the food can be a fail. Have been often enough to be recognized by staff which is nice but my simplest of orders was a disaster - breakfast platter was definitely kept under a warming flame too long so I ended up with burnt toast, charred home fries and unappetizingly crispy eggs. Return? Not at these prices!

Went last night after a visit to the Whitney. Located across the street. We had the Mac and cheese (good), house salad (good), kale and steak salad (not good), fried chicken (good), Brussel Sprouts (not every thing needs to be spicy), a dark and stormy and a Hendricks cucumber martini (both very good). To loud, service was inconsistent (food delivery was good, waitress just ok). While I liked the music selection, it was played too loud.

Went to Bubby's and had a really great experience. The food was great, I had grilled shrimp with a side order of Mac n Cheese. They were both really good! My siblings had burgers and loved them as well. For dessert we had a sundae which was AMAZING. The only reason for 4 stars is the noise level. It was reallyyyy noisy and we could barely hear each other. All in all we had a great experience and I'll definitely eat there again.

Have Nothing but New York Brewery's on tap. We ordered the Bronx brewery and a Krolsch. Then later had the Coney Island brew. All are delicious. Appetizer for me late night eating was nachos and my wife ordered a half plate of pasta. The vibe is so cool. But even after all that it was The bartender who is the best. Very personable very engaging and he gets customer service. I wish all these "cookie cutter - pretty girl" bartender's with their attitudes should witness him and say ohhhh that's how I can make money. Tommy the bartender go and see him.the nachos were good the pasta for me not so much but I didn't have to eat it. They have an old school soda fountain ice cream section in the back lots of fun. Will be back.

My three friends and I went to Bubby's for dinner early on Friday evening.  The place was not crowded.  We were seated and our waiter took our drink order.  $12 glass of wine - a little too high.  It took the waiter a long time to take our food order and food took a long time to be served.  I ordered a Cobb Salad with chicken.  It was no more than lettuce on a plate with four tiny pieces of chicken - hardly the dinner size Cobb Salad.  Our waiter was not attentive at all.  Never asked if we needed anything.  We had to stop the host in order to get ketchup.  The menu was sparse - not a lot of variety.  The menu mentioned brisket but it was not actually on the menu.  When asked, our waiter said it is only available on Sunday brunch - "yeah, that is kind of misleading".  We all left Bubby's sad that we had picked this place.
randomly decided to walk in and try this place out.. I was not disappointed! the nachos, wings, and mac n cheese is soooo good.
The Nashville fried chicken was spiced really good. It is on a artisan slice of bread.

Kid-friendly and decent service, but food is mediocre at best. Ordered many different items for the kids and they didn't care for any (kids quesadilla was limp and tasteless, etc.) and they were out of the two house specialities that the server highly recommended. Expensive (it is meatpacking district, after all) and not awesome. Best to stick to one of the many other restaurants in the area and grab a menu item that can work for your kids rather than choose this spot for all of you to suffer through the menu.

Came here with my mom for a mother, daughter brunch last Sunday and had a fabulous time. The hostess was incredibly nice and patient when we arrived and it didn't take too long to get a table. We ordered the pancakes a few sides and apple cider, the pancakes were so good and soft they just melted in my mouth. The apple cider was delicious and a little spicy, the only thing I didn't love was the bacon, it was a bit tasteless but otherwise everything else was great and the prices weren't too bad for the quantity and quality of food.

Visited in a busy early Sunday evening - take the time to make a reservation or you may wait for a while.  Ambience is casual and comfortable.  Service was very slow - multiple tables around us commented on it.  While our server was very nice she just didn't knock our socks off.  We had the hot spicy chicken appetizer and it was so salty it was inedible.  Too bad because the chicken was juicy but we couldn't get past the seasoning.  We both had burgers which were good and the fries solid. Pricing wise this place seemed on par with the neighborhood but the portions were more than generous.

I love Bubby's --the food+drinks, atmosphere, and company is lovely here! This was the very first restaurant I came to when moving to NY from SF in January. I met a friend for dinner on a Thursday night and we luckily had no wait-- what immediately sold me on Bubby's were the mac n cheese and veggie chili. Talk about two incredible dishes that are super affordable and pretty generously portioned! (Out of the two, I'd go for the veggie chili. The sour scream and tortilla chips that come with it just make the dish sooo yummy.) I have to admit, when my friend suggested a restaurant in the meatpacking district, I thought it was going to be overpriced and full of pretentious people, but I was wrong. Bubby's has been a go-to place for me to grab drinks, and the food makes it only that much better. I went back this past weekend with a friend who was in town from CA, and we went to town on the menu: started out with the brussel sprouts and peppers, and then for entrees: steak, veggie chili, and taco of the day. All of it was so.freaking.good. The brussel sprouts had sriracha sauce infused in them-- wtf? How does that even exist?! Freaking amazing. It's a must-try. and that veggie chili... soo good. And even the taco of the day was pretty decent for Mexican food in NY. Not the best I've ever had, but pretty damn good. Comes with beans, rice, the whole deal! My friend really enjoyed his steak (medium rare) and it's a big portion.The other icing on the cake was that now, Bubby's serves San Francisco beer from a bar there, 21st Amendment. So awesome. :)Tommy and Ricky are so much fun here too- they work the bar and are both super down to earth, personable, and nice. They're a blast to hang out with and there is nothing "pretentious" or "meatpacking" about them-- they're the best. Too bad they're always so busy! Overall, Bubby's is so fun and I plan on coming back here for brunch sometime soon!  :) thanks for making this california girl feel at home!

Overpriced! Plus they threw out the leftovers which were intended for a doggy bag..."oh sorry" said the waitress...plus they "forgot " about one of our entrees!  so the timing of the meal was off- plus we waited for over an hour to get seated in the first place....too many glitches during a meal which was intended for a nice family get together...perhaps it's too popular for the wrong reasons.  How badly do you want $17 french toast? and poorly managed service
Ok the bacon is the most amazing bacon I have ever eaten / and that says so much. It's homemade and succulent. The cold press juices make for a nice balance. Great brunch before the Whitney.

I've come here twice and the food is pretty good but the service is a hit or miss it seems. The first time i came here the server was very attentive and checked up on us. The second time however, we had trouble getting things we needed like the check even though there were only like 10 people in the restaurant.

Breakfast is not reliable.  The first time I went it was good.  Today I went with a group and we all feel sick afterwards.  It didn't taste as fresh and we had to send a side dish back because it was not prepared well.  Maybe it's only good when a certain cook is on?
nice fun. above average meal. matzoball soup A++. would come back. sorry not here to write a story. l am done now
I went back for brunch around 9:30am on a Sunday and it was full of screaming children like some kind of out of control pre-school.  I guess I'll only be going back late nights.

Sweet lord, thank you Bubby's for having ahhhhmazing fresh local pies.  After a late night stroll on the highline, I saw Bubby's To Go like an oasis of baked goods at 11pm on a Wednesday, long after all the other great bakeries in the city were closed.  The woman behind the counter was super helpful in my decision making about which pie to choose from....local apple, seasonal peach, sour cherry, etc.  I ended up with an unbelievably good local cherry pie with a scoop of homemade vanilla bean ice cream.  WIll definitely come back next time I'm at the Highline and want to regain the precious calories lost in my walk.

Bubby's is super charming inside and the service is warm.The food itself isn't bad - it's pretty standard actually.  I got the mac and cheese there, which is borderline too rich, and the collard greens were extremely wet.  The drinks were also very rudimentary.  I'm talking about orange and cranberry juice with vodka as a "specialty cocktail" for over 12 bucks.  The reason for the 2 stars is because they are insanely expensive for the quality.  There is so much better southern and BBQ in the city.  This place is by no means worth what they charge.  Head elsewhere for your BBQ fix.

I had the mocha sundae which included espresso and chocolate ice cream, coffee syrup, a ton of whipped cream and some chocolate chip cookie crumbs on top.  it was good and I liked the syrup, but $12 is pretty pricey for the amount that you get.
good, but expensive. tourist-laden nightmare.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday at 3pm. Very crowded and a bit disorganized with the seating. Ordered the bubby breakfast and the three eggs were poached perfectly but the only decent thing on my plate. If you want burnt hash brows and bland bacon cooked three hours ago, this is the dish for you. The chicken sausage was also burnt but at least had good favor. Will not go back despite the crowd. Tourist trap for sure!

As an avid meatpacking district diner, literally the worst meal ive had in awhile. You could say it was worst than your average applebees. Ribs were literally the worst ive ever had with the most disgusting accompaniment of sauce. Do yourself a favor SKIP this place.
the food was amazing ! I was there for brunch but very happy with all of it !

This place has a great location being right off the high line. I came here for the first time last week. The restaurant has both indoor and outdoor seating and is very cute. They make practically everything on the menu including they're own sodas in many different flavors. I had salmon as an entree which was pretty good. The hush puppy sides were absolutely awesome; I definitely recommend that. The peanut butter pie is great, but I recommend splitting as it's hard to finish! I heard that Bubby's was known for their dessert shaved ice which I got. I much preferred the pie over the ice, but it was worth a shot! Also another dessert that's worth considering to split. The service was great when it wasn't crowded. However, when the restaurant began filling up, it got a little slower including waiting a while for the check. It's a very interesting place with some great menu options worth ordering!

My husband and I love going here for brunch. Sit at the bar and hang out for a few drinks. The bartenders are great! The menu changed in the last year and I don't love it as much as I used to but I just love this place overall.  It's a great way to spend a winter Sunday.

One of my favorite breakfast spots is Bubbys in Tribeca, so when my friend and I were in the Meatpacking district looking for dinner we decided on Bubbys. I will never come to this location again. It was Sunday evening around 7 and not very crowded. I ordered the barbecue with choice of two meats and 2 sides. After placing thw order the waiter returned about 3 minutes later saying they only had chicken. I agreed to only chicken, then but since they had green beans as a special I requested that as a side. He said it wasn't an option. Several minutes later he returned to explain they were out of broccoli so I would need to order another side. I requested the green beans to which he said it was a $2 upcharge since it wasn't one of the sides. I agreed to pay the extra. A few minutes later he returned to say they were out of the other side i had ordered. At this point my friend said let's go somewhere else. The waiter said "I dont blame you, I would too". Pretty strange to be out of so much food and the wait staff not even know until after each order was placed.

Breakfast is to die for, the Eggs Florentine is outta site! The atmosphere, the drinks (especially the Root Beer!) and service all were just perfect. Please open a location in Austin, Tx and show them how it is done!!

An absolute delight. We just went to the soda/ice cream spot, and were seriously impressed. Amazing selection, and the staff there really know their stuff. Love that so much of the produce is home made. Orange cream soda and kitchen sink ice cream with 16 scoops were particular highlights. Massive thumbs up.

Pretty decent brunch! I'm fine paying over $20 for my entree, but I'd rather if it was for something really special. I can get good eggs benedict anywhere else. We were told it was going to be an hour wait for a group of 5 and it ended up being more like 45 minutes (this is on a Sunday), but I think we got lucky. I was interested in trying their juices but for $10? Really? No thank you.
Good Food, great drinks, poor service. We were told a 30 min wait, ended up being an hour fifteen. Waited at the bar, our drinks took 45 mins. No bueno

I had a burger with avocado, mushrooms and caramelized onions, and it was one of the best I ever had. The kids burgers in contrast tasted pretty bad and the wedge salad had a very strange flavor profile... If you don't pick the wrong dish this place can be quite good...

This location needs to get there act together, the food is great however service is really bad. clusters of waiters sit on the side lines while customers look to order.I understand this is a new location however the staff makes it seems like they have never worked in a restaurant  . I have gone multiple times in the last couple of weeks and the service continues to go from bad to worse.  management needs to step in and help service get a lot better.
Great sandwiches and sodas with a selection so dizzyingly fun it took several minutes to decide. I got the grapefruit, which at $5, I thought could not be worth it. But it nearly was!

I work in the neighborhood and frequent this location often, usually the to-go counter. The food is always amazing, never disappoints. To the chefs + cooks, keep doing what you're doing! The service staff, however, is a different story. Half the time I want to walk out because I feel as if I'm being ignored. It always takes forever to get a coffee or pastry- forget a latte. The guy that works at the to-go counter never has a smile on his face and always seems in a bad mood. Bottom line- the service needs help.
Food was great the atmosphere is interesting. Really enjoyed the experience.  We walked the high line park and the restaurant is right outside of the entrance
Overall the food was good but the service today was a little slow. I'd still recommend it and I'll be back!

Really disappointed in the food. Tartine, Cluny and Bonbonniere all better and much less expensive. Bubby's coffee is the worst! Sour and no one drank it since it didn't resemble coffee. Staff is very polite although they could use more training; maybe that will come with time. Ambience is very nice.Mr. Silver, your 'Comments' card could use some editing. I don't want to have to explain to my children what F@&K is. If you want people to write comments and leave them for you use polite words that won't offent the people who frequent nice restaurants.
regardless of how crowded it was on a Sunday brunch after the NFW, the manager Carlos made sure everything was perfect. great experience. highly recommended.

Bubby's used to be awesome.  Now it's awful.  Known for their desserts and especially pies (they have a pie book) I was shocked to get a terrible slice of chocolate pudding meringue pie; tasteless and bad. At $8 a slice it's a total joke.  It wasn't worth $1.50.  #sad
I like this place. The food is good and they use products from local farms. Also, they have these sodas that they make and taste awesome, like blueberry, mango, cherry etc. sodas. They are delicious.

This place is cool when it comes to ambience and beer. Be ready for them to be out a lot of stuff. I went on a Monday and they didn't have quite a few items. The server took forever to tell me that they were out of stuff I felt it was a little excessive. Has a really cool hipster vibe but I think it's a bit overpriced for what you get as well. My service really sucked but you can give it a shot if you want

I am a neighbor in the West Village. Went to Bubby's several nights ago. The physical place is cozy and wonderful.. The music was pretty loud.. I thought they had promised that the music was to be very low and sort of folksy.Found myself shouting at my companion.. We had a really mediocre burger( 15 bucks), tasteless fries  (five bucks) and some booze.. and ended up with a high bill.. Unfortunately, the meatpacking district is all about the rent.. I may go back for a piece of pie.. I think a whole pie sells for $65..This kind of place shold be priced at a level that their staff( and the neighborhood) could afford to eat at. Yikes..

Great location, fun vibe and ample options for casual dinner following energetic walk on the High Line.  Options to satisfy a vegan or carnivore.   Jason was the perfect waiter, helpful with good suggestions, yet not intrusive.

I am a huge fan of Bubbys and they would definitely get more stars if they let strollers in. The staff, management, good, atmosphere-- it's all perfect, but after holding a table for a friend for about an hour, we had to leave because they won't let you bring in strollers. So we went to the standard and had a subpar meal with terrible staff.. So as a review, Bubbys is great, standard is not, leave your strollers at home.
Had their hot cherry pie and chocolate sundae and loved it. Finished it before could take a pic, sorry !!

Usually a great place, nice servers, greeters,,,,good comfort food. Today, however, were way off their game. Although its not on the menu, asked for a BLT,,,kitchen says no can do,,,come on, this is not rocket science,,,chef with an attitude? They have bread, they have bacon, they have tomatoes, they have lettuce,,,,, whats the problem?The poor server, who was trying to be helpful, suggested we order some kind of breakfast that we could reassemble into a blt. Why would the restaurant torture the server in this way? Then, we are told no pastrami today,,,,,well thats ok,,,then i order the pulled pork,,,no pork today.....ok, so i order the cobb salad,,but i just have to check that they have the ingredients,,,happily they doThis is a great place having a very, very bad day

Went here last night after trying to find a place in the Meatpacking district that wasn't pretentious - and we were successful! My friend and I had the biscuits to start which were PERFECTION. They were buttery, soft and came with homemade jam and butter, I wish I had them all to myself! (Side note - my friend is from Alabama and said that these were just like the ones she gets back home). As our mains, we each had burgers (cooked medium). They were juicy and delicious. I had the caramelized onions on mine which were a great touch. In a nutshell, this place is amazing and I already have plans to go there this weekend for brunch. Excited to see how that goes!

Came here for a late dinner, all we ordered was the matzo ball soup and a salad. We waited for 45 minutes for the food to come and the server completely forgot about us the entire time. Worst service I've ever seen.

We had just finished walking the High Line and this is the first place you see when you get to the bottom of the final set of stairs in the Meatpacking district.  It was beautiful out and they had lots of outdoor seating...so we decided to give them a try.  It was busy but we were seated right away (it was 7:30 on a thursday).  Our waiter was great!  Friendly and quick.  He had good suggestions too.  Hubby got the dark and stormy drink and LOVED it.  They had a nice selection of specialty mixed drinks on their menu.  For dinner we shared the blistered shishito peppers and the BBQ platter.  The platter wasn't huge and would have been fine for one person but we weren't very hungry so splitting it was perfect.  We chose the ribs and sausage.  The sausage was spicy with some sort of cheese in it....so good!  We also shared a slice of strawberry rubarb pie with home made ice cream.  We really enjoyed everything and were so glad we decided to stop there.
Just finishing an excellent meal.  Great kale salad, burgers, sandwiches. Everything was very fresh, interesting and delicious!  Perfect for lunch after a visit to the Whitney.
Relaxed bar atmosphere in the high line.  Didn't try any food but it looked tempting.  Great and friendly service.  Will come back for brunch or dinner.

45 minutes wait time. $20 pancakes that were actually good (besides being a tad overpriced). However, my side of sausage was pretty bad. Someone ordered a burger and it looked dry. So may be their specialty is pancakes? Glad I ordered those. Loud, difficult to hear people. Bad service. Forgot my coffee. Never got water. All in all, if you must have brunch at meatpacking, head on over - if you don't mind the wait and stick with pancakes you'll be fine. Otherwise, NYC got better options.

WOW! What a great place to stumble upon for dinner! A bunch of my girlfriends and I were supposed to go to the Sugar Factory for one of my girlfriends birthday, didn't work out to say the least! We came across this place just a few blocks away and I'm so glad we ended up here instead! Wonderful, slightly quiet atmosphere (they played such great music!) The wait staff was small but our waiter Jeff - yes I remember him by name he was so nice - was very helpful. Mostly American food with what I considered extremely reasonable prices for organic and in Manhattan. A must try app - the vegetarian cowboy nachos! They were amazing won't disappoint and I'm not even big on veggies! All their drinks were made by their brand, even sodas. Everything they have is organic. This place it one you should definitely hit while in the city.
Very good lentil burger and nachos. They make their own root beer which was really good. Their ice cream was great also would come back.
Love the ambience and food here.  Nice little spot hidden in the meatpacking.  Def coming back!

Just went there friday night after walking by and I looked at the reviews just now and saw them getting panned for the same reasons we didn't like it. My friends burger was suppose to be medium rare and it was except the outside was burned. The manager offered to comp in the burger and send another one out which was wonderful and thoguhtful, but when it came out it was burnt on the outside again. I don't make it a point to pan a place but the kitchen guys suck. The service was fine but they need to retrain the kitchen guys, they suck! lastly, $27 fried chicken. HAD NO FLAVOR!!!!! the crust was nice and it was tender but the fried chicken was FLAVORLESS!!! I had to ask for salt and pepper to season it myself. how cruel!!!! and on top of that, the corn that I ordered was pasty as if they boiled it, left it sitting on a counter then threw it on the grill to offer a burnt flavor and then served it up. The mac n' cheese was okay but no flavor again. Once again, the staff was okay, but the kitchen crew, they should be replaced with real cooks

The entire meal, short rib pot roast and short rib pot pie, was delicious! We ended with the apple pie and the Michigan sour cherry pie. The cherry pie was phenomenal! The crust was light and flaky, the cherry filling was tart and just sweet enough. Can't wait to go back again.
cool homemade sodasfab saladsdelicious pancakesnice staffwhat do you want more...

Bubby's definitely lives up to the hype. I thought it was going to be another trendy, way overpriced, Meatpacking District restaurant but was pleasantly surprised. I went for lunch with coworkers and we had the nachos, fries, and biscuits to start off (carb overload). The nachos were amazing and absolutely the best I've ever had. I wish I would have gotten the nachos for my meal alone so I didn't have to share. For lunch I had a cheeseburger and fries and it was delicious. I did ask for no bun because I have a gluten allergy but it came out on a bun so they don't cater to allergies very well but nonetheless it was great. I had the lemonade as well and it was very sweet and very good. It came out pink which I wasn't expecting, and it was served in an adorable mason jar it almost was too pretty to drink. My coworkers raved about the biscuits (which I couldn't have but I'll take their word they were amazing) and everyone was extremely happy with the place. The atmosphere is laid back, casual and very comfortable. I will definitely be going back and cannot to see what the dessert menu has to offer.
The drinks are awesome, the bartender was funny, and the pancakes are amazing! Great ambiance for brunch!
Solid place for a hang-over brunch, a lot of good quality carbs on the menu. Recommended!. :-)
Great brunch. Everything locally sourced and not processed. Good wholesome traditional food. Nice big portions. Nice chill vibe.

I've always liked Bubby's, so when I saw the High Line location, I made a beeline for it. Were the prices always this high at the other locations? Staggering! So, I ordered a smoked salmon benedict. It was piled high with salmon -- great, right? -- except when the salmon tastes really fishy, which it did. I was very put off. The cappucino was good, on the other hand. The staff was superfriendly. I might be going back, but just not ordering that again.

Had a terrible experience here on a Sunday afternoon/evening. Arrived right at 5PM. There were at least a dozen open tables (half the restaurant). We were told it would be a 20 minute wait due to reservations. After waiting at the crowded bar for 35 minutes we were finally seated (although we didn't see any of the other reservations come in). It took another 20 minutes to have a server even speak to us. I ordered a medium rare burger -- it came bloody and cold. Completely undercooked. By the time I sent it back and they returned a new, "medium-rare" burger, my dining companions meal was completely cold and inedible. After complaining first about the wait to the manager, we were given a glass of wine each, and after the burger incident we were given an unwanted piece of cake from the server. The server was actually nice and felt badly about our experience but nothing could have made up for the generally awful experience. The hostess and manager were rude and not sincerely apologetic or understanding about the irrational wait times and overall experience. Sure, throw in a free drink and free cake -- which we didn't really want either of, but be sincere.  Literally will never go back or recommend this to anyone. A shame as it's in a convenient location and has a lively casual atmosphere for a weekend meal. Save the trouble and spend your money anywhere else.
These pancakes are addictive!! Loved the coffee, atmosphere, huevos rancheros was amazing and the waiter was surprisingly cheerful.

Delicious American food.  The veggie burger was one of the best I have ever eaten.  The spicy broccoli was superb too.  Very fresh food. It was $80 for four if us along with an appetizer.  I would eat there again.

I had dinner at Bubby's in Tribeca awhile back and really loved the food. The High Line location is nice, but I definitely prefer the atmosphere of the Tribeca one. I had breakfast here and realized how painfully overpriced everything is considering what you get. I spent $25 for two pancakes, two over easy eggs, and one (really, really dry) sausage and an iced coffee. The pancakes were really dense and heavy, and overall the breakfast dish was just okay, and certainly not worth $20 for the plate. I think what they have for dinner is worth the price but I probably won't be getting breakfast here again.
